text: Amazing food! Great portion size with reasonable prices as well! Was my first time and the employee was very helpful and friendly in guiding me through the "build your own" process. Will definitely be returning!
I just love this place. It's healthy and delicious. The food is fresh and they have a big menu to choose from

The service was really good; the girl behind the counter offered great service for a first time customer who didn't know the ordering procedure. However, I was not impressed with the food; it was ok. I ordered hummus with gyro meat. The meat consistancy is chunked and moist. The "classic hummus" is not the same as traditional hummus; their classic contains garlic and has more of a chunky consistancy rather than thick and smooth. Overall, it was ok, but I will stick to the more traditional Mediterranean restaurants.

I want to preface my review with the fact that my Mediterranean knowledge is based on a handful of places in the valley; some better than others, (in my opinion).  At the risk of the yelp*ing community throwing themselves off Camelback mountain, I have to say that Pita jungle sort of sets the bar for me when it comes to overall taste, portion size, and quality.  Having said that, I was fortunate to try Hummus Xpress (hard to take the place serious with the name) this afternoon.  Based on the reviews alone, I was expecting a lot and was not disappointed. Live music, handful of tables, not much of a line and fairly straightforward system of ordering.  If you read more than two other reviews, I don't have to repeat the process.  It was nice to get some guidance from the line, though I was a little confused by the pricing aspect: .60 cents per item on veggies.  I wasn't clear if that was across the menu or just that region but I was so aware of it that it kept me from really wanting to pile on anymore than a single veggie.  Portion size was adequate, the bowl can hold a lot of food and you fill the bowl easily with delicious ingredients.  I sampled a few flavors of hummus and too be honest, I prefer my hummus warm which this was not but was still tasty.  What seems like a limited menu actually is fairly vast and it would be possible to have the same thing twice only by accident.  Pitas were soft and warm and the iced tea was special.  Push-button iced tea is an abomination so it was nice to see handwritten exotic flavors that didn't make you roll your eyes.  Hummus Xpress (*sigh) is now in the rotation and on the board for a good quality lunch.

Wonderful food, great atmosphere!  Love going here for lunch.  Such an array of fresh and unusual flavors. A real treat. The staff are exceedingly friendly and if you are stuck for choice will pick their favorite for you. Even the iced tea is awesome!
Friendly staff, a large variety of flavors and reasonable prices.  If you are wanting a healthy alternative check them out.
So delicious! Great for veg and nonveg ppl. The food is actually flavorful and pretty healthy. The service is also amazing really genuine and sincere. Loved it and would recommend it for lunch!

We picked this place based on yelp reviews.  Thanks!! This is now our "go to" for gyros.
This place offers a nice amount of toppings, awesome make your own pita/plate/bowl.

Please give this local business a shot.
Excellent!!  Terrific service, clean and the food was fantastic!  This was my first visit but I will be back for sure.

Absolutely great find, simple but accurate middle eastern food. Service is superb, super nice and patient. Food tastes good, Falafel is lacking and not on par with the rest of the meal. Overall a very pleasant surprise in an unassuming location.

Similar concept to Chipotle, but Mediterannean style. The portions were large and the price was good. You either get to choose a plate, pita, or bowl. You then go down the row and get to pick a meat, hummus, salad, and cooked vegetable option as well as unlimited raw vegetable toppings. I order half grilled chicken, half falafel bowl with grilled zucchini, tabouleh, a combination of lemon/ginger and jalapeno/cilantro hummus, and a ton of vegetable toppings. Everything tasted incredible and the employees were exceptionally friendly and helpful. I will definitely be coming back here!

Damn, yea this place is great. I like the comparison to Chipotle, it definitely fits.
Its well priced, I got 2 meals for $8-9. 
Standard Mediterranean faire, and well done. You could make all sorts of combos out of their selection.
Definitely check it out either for lunch or dinner.

Loved my lunch veggie plate. All of the ingredients had their own flavor and texture, although some people may not like having everything piled on top of each other in the bowl. Doesn't bother me!
Hummus was very delicious. Different than others around. I need to get more so I can put my finger on it. The jalapeno hummus was actually spicy which I've never had before. Other places just don't add enough I guess lol
The eggplant was tough and tasted like it was out for awhile so I'll probably skip that next time (I came in at noon so not sure why so stale? ). The pita was very elastic and glutenous which I did not care for but it's not important for a plate. Didn't need it but I would've loved a more bready pita that's just my taste though.
space is small and parking limited so plan accordingly.  Employees were efficient and friendly. Can't wait to go back!
This place is great!  The owner is the Chef and uses fresh home made from scratch food.  Each dish has delicious flavor!  There are endless combinations!  Even my 2 1/2 yr old son loved it!

This place is amazing. Nice little gem in Tempe. A nice variety of hummus my favorite being the chipotle hummus. The food is fresh and delicious and the staff is friendly and very good service. Enjoy!!!!
This place never let's me down! A great takeout option ! The meat is always juicy and the various sides are delish!

I have had this restaurant bookmarked for a long time. I just had the pleasure of ordering today. I ordered the bowl, hoping that I would be full. I was definitely content after enjoying it. The flavors of each item complimented each other very well. Everything was seasoned perfectly. I usually eat slow, but I ate this bowl very quickly. 
Also, my review is based solely on the food taste and quality, I did not dine in or pick up the food myself. I am looking forward to eating here again very soon.

My boyfriend and I eat here once a week. The food is great quality, healthy, and delicious. We've never had a bad experience. Everyone that works here is always nice. We are so glad we found this place!

One Tempe's highlights! You can basically build tour own dish like at Chipotle. A bowl for example starts with rice, a choice of meat or two veggies, salads (lentils, beans etc), hummus (such as ginger - lemon,  jalapeño, cilantro, plain etc.) and all sorts of fresh toppings like veggies, lettuce, cheese, olives etc and last but not least a sauce (garlic aioli, Chili, yogurt etc). It is served with a pit (wheat or white).
Simple but sooo good and also somewhat healthy compared to other fast foods!

I never post reviews but this place is a small business that deserves a chance at success and growth because their food and service is that good.  I go there for lunch at least one time per week and I have never had a meal less than great and the staff is always noticeably on top of their game.
Good gyro's. Great selections for toppings. Quick service. Ok hummus.

I love that place. Created my own bowl with rice, gyro, carrots, lentil salad and many other delicious ingredients. Awesome food! Everything is fresh and tastes good. And the owners are very friendly.
Hands down the best Mediterranean food in Tempe.   From the hummus to the rice everything is packed with flavor.  The owner is also incredibly friendly and the portions are generous.

Amazing food, friendly staff and did I already say the dood was AMAZING?! Fresh and flavorful dishes consistently.  No complaints here... if you love hummus and/or Mediterranean food, do your tastebuds a favor and try HUMMUS XPRESS!!!

Excellent place to get some Greek/Mediterranean food. Found this place using yelp while on a business trip and the rating was spot on. They have many options for your bowl or pita sandwich and all the toppings are very flavorful. Try this place out if you are in the area.

Delicious options to make your bowl your way. Their staff is very friendly and always greet you (and remember you if you frequent) they offer samples of the hummus if you're not sure which one to get.

I really do love this place, it's just become too hit or miss. I used to eat here almost every day, along with my staff. The owner Eddie, and Nick always hooked it up and are really friendly. All the other staff they've had over the last couple years make me not want to come back, they'd serve half to a third of the food I used to get, they're not friendly and there was a long spell of risky to the stomach food. I wish I could eat here every day again, I love the food they have on good days.

Independently owned. Operated by some of the coolest workers you'll meet and the food is just great. They always change the menu up a little to keep it interesting with multiple choices of hummus, meat, veggies, salad choices and toppings. If Eddie is there, tell em ZeeDubb sent you lol

Incredibly happy I tried this place. Easy 5 stars. The staff was great but more importantly the food was better. My wife is here for the Ironman and she gives it the healthy thumbs up too. Wish there was one where I live.
Tried this place today and it was BOMB the gyro bowl was amazing. The staff was friendly and funny. Def will be back
First time coming here and they were incredibly helpful and kind. The food will not disappoint either.

Food is good and fresh. I am a regular there for lunch. Two minor issues are - firstly that there are multiple attendants and sometimes the serving size really varies from bowl full to bowl 3/4 full. And secondly usage of same serving spoon/tongs for all meats is a bit of a growl for me - It doesn't bother me but I would prefer if serving spoon/tongs are kept separate. The attendants are very polite and nice and almost always wish you when you arrive and when you leave.
Staff was friendly and helpful. Food was delicious and full of delicious flavors! Located in a section of town with so many fast food places, this is a welcome find for a healthy delicious meal!

I'm so excited to come back here!! They had the friendliest workers and willing to recommend different items. Hummus was amazing I got the cilantro jalapeño and the spicy. They were phenomenal! I will be bringing friends here to try it out. This is definately one if my favorite places now. Quick easy delicious you can't go wrong!!! It's a must try

SO GOOD! We were offered samples of their hummus so we we could make the right choice. If you're really hungry grab the "Plate" otherwise a "Bowl" will do. Tasty, filling served with a warm wheat or white pita! A must go :)

Love the food here!! And am here often, almost once a week. Today the portion size for a bowl was half the normal. 1/2 scoop rice, 3 pieces eggplant, 5 pieces of gyro, 1/2 spoon of hummus for $6.95????? Really!!

First time eating eggplant.  Love it.  Chipotle Hummus is my favorite.  As a vegan, the Three Vegetables are enough, as you can pick toppings and sauces.  
--  The PITA is cheaper than the bowl, with the same portion of food.  
You can't go wrong with any of the options here.  Very clean, professional, super friendly, and Xtremely worth the 6.95 at Hummus Xpress.
I always have a great lunch here.  The options available to mix and match are a great mix of healthy and flavorful.  Today they even had 2 jazz guitarists playing which I hope will be there again.

Delicious.  Great falafel.  Always great service and they're always accommodating.  

Also if you're not sure about anything ask if you can taste it, they will gladly let you try anything.

I went to this place because I needed something to eat on my lunch work break and I try to take the fun relatively healthy approach.

This is NOT another Pita Pit. The owner/CHEF Eddie is right there working hard.

It's like gourmet food to go.  He compared it as the Chipotle of Mediterranean cuisine, I agree but even more so. He told me how the pitas come from a local bakery fresh (can't remember name), and he was most exuberant describing everything.

There were a lot of choices and I didn't know where to start because I don't know this cuisine and Eddie was more than happy to put together a pita combination as he is a chef. He asked me if I wanted vegetarian or not and then he went down the line putting a combination together for me on the fly working with my preferences.

When I finally had my pita (see picture) the flavors were awesome! I was tasting something I could very happily eat in a sit down restaurant. I do not know where else you can get such a high quality food quickly and for a decent cost.

I would not have known about this place but for friends posting pictures of amazing looking hummus bowls on instagram. This place is tucked into a strip mall that, for whatever reason, I have never had occasion to visit despite living 1/4 mile from it for the majority of my adult life. Although strip mall is generally depressing (it's next to an MMJ doctor and a dry cleaner) the atmosphere is clean and modern if a bit stark. 

A reviewer below mentioned that this is sort of a middle eastern Chipotle, which is a useful comparison. You basically chose a bowl, a pita, or a platter. Each option entitles you to a certain number of meats (or vegetables) and an unlimited number of toppings. The proprietor is more than friendly and guides you through the process, perhaps a bit too thoroughly, but it's great to see an engaged small business owner who cares about his product. 

The food is outstanding. I'm a vegetarian and my girlfriend is vegan and there were plenty of options. Every filling was extremely flavorful in a non-cloying way. Sometimes the prospect of eating vegetables and hummus leaves something to be desired, but dishes like the roasted eggplant, cous cous, and the various hummuses (hummusi?) were so interesting and complex that I was excited to go back and try the dishes I missed. 

I would have given the place 4 stars if not for one quibble - VEGAN TAX. Allow me to explain. Some establishments, this one included, do not deduct a dollar (or two) for omitting meat from the meal. There is no way that hummus costs as much as lamb, so in theory, a vegetarian bowl should reflect the difference in price. Instead of reducing the price accordingly, places that charge the same essentially profit from the difference between the cost of a meat dish and that of a vegan dish. In my opinion, this shouldn't be passed off on vegans/vegetarians, and essentially operates as a tax on vegans. If the guy lowered the price of a veggie pita/bowl/platter, I would go here more often.

Vegan tax aside, the food is great and fresh and the staff is nice. I'll definitely go here again and would recommend it to friends.

This place is a perfect, healthier option in the Tempe area. The food tastes fresh, the pricing is very good for the amount of food you get and the staff are so friendly. I will definitely eat here again!
I could eat here every day.The freshest most delicious ingredients, and to top it off a wonderful staff! Love everything about this place :)

This place is great.. I usually go to pita jungle to get my hummus fix but with this place I have no need (other then pita jungles ahi tuna hummus)... The portions are big, I had food for dinner and lunch the next day when ordering the plate. the price is cheap. Great quality, everything I put in my mouth was delicious....

I was in and out in a matter of minutes with my to go order.

Would/will go back and definitely recommend to my friends and family.
So good!  Found on Yelp 3 weeks ago and gave eaten lunch here 3 times since. Very fresh. Cilantro jalapeño hummus has a kick.   Love this place!! Only suggestion is better pita...seems kind of hard

Obsessed with this place would be putting it mildly. 

The veggies and meat from this place are seriously to die for. It's basically like a Chipotle setup but with locally sourced ingredients, diverse and healthy, Mediterranean choices and scrumptious. Pick a pita, plate, salad or platter and choose from something like 20+ choices! 

Really love the diverse amounts of hummus they have. Beet hummus and cilantro/jalapeno are probably my faves together. Stack it piled with veggies, rice, choice of meat, type of salad, additional toppings and ta-da - a masterful meal to enjoy! Oh and the portions? HUGE! Left-overs for days. 

This is a must try if you're in the area. Just writing this makes my mouth water, seriously it's that good!
When I want delicious variety I come here. You can appease the meat eater in you or go vegan. It is all good. The pistachio baklava was pretty great too.

I would call myself a foodie and have had a lot of Mediterranean food and so the reason I gave this place 2 stars because it the flavors are not quite what I was expecting. It taste like they tried to get too fancy with the food but did not succeed in doing so. The topping they offer have too much going on and leave a weird after taste. They gyro meat is not traditional. It is thick and only somewhat taste like gyro meat. The hummus is ok but it has more liquid than most other hummus. It makes the pita soggy. The pita bread itself is store bought and nothing special about it. But what really moved me to write the review was that I found a hair in my food. I only ate 1/4 of it and was done.

Whoa...I just had the hummus w/ chicken. Great price! Great portion! Almost couldn't finish it all. It was much better than I expected. The hummus was amazing. The employees were incredible nice and helpful. I'm upset I've waited this long to try it. I'll probably be back tomorrow. Heathy food at a good price...doesn't get much better than that for me.

I've always enjoyed going to Hummus Express but have found recently that whenever I go with my girlfriend and I we are treated very rudely by whoever is helping us with our food. My girlfriend went in by herself today and when she got back home she told me she felt awkward there because the guy preparing her food was giving her sexual innuendos and hitting on her while winking multiple times. This is not respectable towards customers at all and it is making me be tentative going back which I will hate because I enjoy the food and have enjoyed the service in the past.

Numerous great options to choose from! Who knew ginger hummus existed! The staff were cool & super nice to us. I personally  preferred  take out to eating in. I almost wish the location (strip mall) was a little better..like next to a natural foods store instead of a pet store. Loved it nevertheless!
Good food but unprofessional employees. Bring it up a notch behavior-wise and you got a great eatery.

Yum Yum Yum !!!  

I'm so glad finally a place that does authentic Schwma on the Gyro spit.  Delicious meat and toppings with an assortment of well seasoned veggies.  The guys that work there are super nice and offer tastes if you're unsure of what to get.  Nice fluffy Pita with great hummus.  Everything tasted very fresh and home made. This has become a favorite lunch spot if you want to eat healthy fresh food and are tired of going to Chipotle.

Tried this place for the first time and was very impressed. The owner/chef made a ton of helpful (and delicious) suggestions, the food was great and the price was on point. We went mid-afternoon time and the food tasted freshly made. Also worth mentioning-this place is very allergy/vegetarian/vegan friendly.

After reading the other reviews, I'm pretty much just seconding most of them.  It really is like a Mediterranean Chipotle:  Pick your size, pick your rice, pick your veggies, pick your meat, pick more veggies, pick your hummus, pick your sauce.  It's awesome, very delicious, everything fresh.  

Price is "fair".  Not expensive, not cheap.  Just fair.  My meal with a drink is like $10.

The owner/manager was also incredibly helpful in recommendations, descriptions, etc.  Great guy.

Even had a couple of kids playing sax/guitar a few times, if that's your thing.

The food was very good, but the customer service was bad. 

Arriving during a lunch break, I was happy there wasn't a line. The toppings - "fill-its" - were fresh and I liked the choices. The place was relatively clean. 

But the crew treat people impatiently. They give you this look, half expecting you to rapid-fire your selections because (what, there's something else they should be doing) and half impatient that the line doesn't move faster or that they don't want to answer your questions. This is how it goes:

Dude: "what do you want?"
You: "cabbage please"
Dude: * pinches out three scraps of red cabbage * what else you want?
You: can I get more cabbage please?
Dude: * wags his head * Sorry! We're all about portion control here. Manager. What else you want?
You: can I get olives
Dude: you can get whatever you want as long as you know what you want 
(Direct quote)

Hopefully it was just a bad shift cause the customer service sucks. But the food was good. My coworkers laughed because ordering was an exercise in patience and negotiating. Be prepared to do battle with those dudes.

Hands down my go-to healthy food stop.  Staff are ALWAYS friendly and the food is fresh and made with love. Never disappointed when I walk into these doors. Please don't ever go anywhere...if anything expand and share the love around the valley!
Still amazing every time. Don't pay attention to the bad reviews people don't know what good food is! Just tried halal guys at Grand opening and this is still my favorite place to eat in tempe!

Went for the first time yesterday with a friend for lunch, right at the height of noon.  They were busy, but handling the rush.  I had a falafel plate, and while I had a short wait for the falafel, the taste of everything was outstanding.  My plate was falafel, eggplant, regular hummus, rice, some veggies and goat cheese with a regular pita (wheat was an option).  My friend had chicken.  We both left full and happy!!  Very affordable for a fresh lunch option in Tempe, healthy and filling as well.  I will definitely be back.  Glad to be the 100th review  Whoo hoooo.
Bland food. Serving wasn't well eg rice was cold, gyro wasn't well done, etc. kale wasnt well cut... not recommended.

One of the best food places in Tempe! Everything is made in house, is super fresh, and incredibly tasty. The gyro meat is the best I've had. And the prices are unbeatable. Ive met the owner and hes very passionate about the food and his restauarant. Cannot recommend enough! Do yourself a favor and eat at Hummus Express!
If you like chipotle and you like Mediterranean food, then this hits the spot. The choices are better and the food is better.

I love this place. The food is great and you get a lot of food for your money. The staff is very friendly and considerate. BUT FOR THE LOVE OF GOD! Put on some gloves!!! It is disgusting! I think this is mostly the younger guys that work here and not the owner. One young man had two gloves on, one had one glove on. He grabbed plates and pitas with his bare hands, and the cashier had no gloves on. I watched the cashier touch money, touch food items, then touch money again. Luckily he didn't handle any of my food, I would have politely asked him to put gloves on. He did scoop a side of sauce for us sans gloves, he dipped his finger in the first cup, he tossed that one, scooped another and spilled it on his hand. He then went back to cashiering. This grosses me out to no end. So unsanitary. Please please please educate your employees on food handling!

Amazing food and wonderful service! I wasn't sure how the setup worked but the staff was very friendly, made great recommendations, and they let me sample a few things as well! A bowl has a lot of food- neither my boyfriend nor I could finish it! I love that they offer falafels as a vegetarian option, and the beet hummus is a must try (I don't even like beets). Go here NOW!
So good every time!! We go here often on lunch break. The employees are super awesome and the food is awesome! Great spot!

This place is exactly how everyone else described it... the Chipotle of Mediterranean food. The portions are super gracious and the food is awesome. They even got me excited about vegetables. Everything looked super delicious and I can't wait to go back. The staff was super friendly and I even heard them call customers by their names. I can't wait to go back!
Construction shouldn't stop you from eating a dish like this.The menu has actually grown from my last visit it's better.I am all for gluten-free and vegetables yum.

High Quality, 'Chipotle' Style Mediterranean Food 
This is as good as it gets! Service is always very very friendly and their food is fresh, home-made, vegan/vegetarian, and tasty! I am always impressed by the quality of vegetables and meats, their gyro is some of my favorite, the grilled chicken a close second. Their hummus is a huge bonus, made in house, they typically have 6 different types that rotate. I can't decide which is my favorite they are all unique and delicious. Lemon ginger is fantastic,  you won't find it anywhere else, and the cilantro jalapeño is great if you like spice. I recommend any of their 3 or 4 different kale salads as well as their spicy ginger carrots. The 'pita' sized plate is more than enough food for one, and is just around $6 or $7. You won't regret going here.

We were greeted warmly and the chef seemed very enthusiastic about his food. I was expecting the standard fair- hummus, falafel, and salad. I was happily surprised to find so many healthy options- several varieties of hummus, eggplant, kale, broccoli, carrots, lentil salad... they offered me so much I had to order it all in a bowl with pita on the side. All the flavors mixed together perfectly.

A small detail that I appreciated- we were dining at a very slow time of day, but the iced tea was fresh and tasty- no stale left-over beverage from the lunch crowd.

This restaurant will definitely be a new favorite for me.

I have to say that I was taken aback by the freshness and quality of the food here. I was a little nervous about eating at a place in a strip mall, but am very happy that I was convinced to do so. The food was delicious, the staff was very helpful in helping me pick out items, and the portions are extremely generous. The staff described the setup/ordering as "Chipotle, for Mediterranean food". This place kicks that 'C' word restaurant's butt. Cannot wait to return. Rice, veggies, gyro meat, hummus, feta cheese, sauce, and pita were all delicious. I'm salivating while typing this up... sorry keyboard :)

This is one of the best experiences I've had in quite a while.  The employee made sure to greet us and let us know how everything worked.  I built a plate and I told him to just to pick his favorites.  He ended up giving me a btt of all three meats, two kinds of hummus and a ton of toppings.  It was delicious, cheap ($10 for more food than I could eat), and friendly.  Will definitely be going back often.

The best Hummus place in Tempe! The owners are super generous and helpful helping you find a meal that you like. The vegetables are perfectly seasoned and cooked. The array of meat choices is mouth watering and there are vegan options too! Everything was fresh and delicious. Thank god for this place! I loved my ride on the Hummus Express!
Definitely not the prettiest food out there and I was a little confused how to order but the service was great and the food was tasty. I'll be back for more!

Super friendly staff that stayed open a little later so we could get our fix! Beet Hummus, Kale salad, fresh falafel! I highly recommend EVERYTHING on the menu. Seriously, it's quick and delicious! A rarity in a sea of fried fast-food "restaurants".
Awesome food.  Quick.   Healthy.  Friendly service.  Soo glad I found this place.

I finally had the chance to make it over here after having this place bookmarked for like 5 months now. Just like every other review said before this one, the concept is like a chipotle but with Middle Eastern ingredients. I got as much as I could fit in the plate of awesomeness to include: rice, gyro meat, roasted eggplant, carrots, chipotle hummus, tabouli salad, tzatziki, lettuce and shug (many different spellings of this word). Also, a choice of wheat or white pita was also included. Overall the food was good and I would definitely come back to have some more. The only negative that happened was that they ran out of tahini sauce. Not the biggest deal, but Mediterranean food would be complete without it. Hopefully this place will be able to expand to other locations.
Great schwarma! Felt like I was back in Israel! Highly recommended if you're looking for authentic Israeli schwarma.

Food is delicious! I have eaten here a few times and have had a good experience every time. The food is fast and fresh. My favorite hummus is chipotle. I'm not usually a big fan of eggplant but I love theirs!

Excellent food. The amount of choices is great and the employees are very helpful. We confirmed it was our first visit and they walked us through the food choices.  Got the plate with chicken, kale, lentil salad, cucumbers, tomatoes, and zucchini flavored hummus. So good!! My manager for falafel with hers and they made it right then. Great place and will definitely visit again
Awesome falafel, this place is the best in Phoenix, no doubt, you definitely get your money's worth of hummus,  falafel,  chicken,  and rice, always satisfied. ..

We were set to fail. After watching Eat Street on the Cooking Channel, we new we were setting ourselves up for nothing but disappointment. Out we go to hunt for Moroccan food.  Hey, it's Mediterranean... it also starts with M.

THE PLACE: Very very simple. Not very big and not a lot of seats, but number of seating is just right for the space.  It was clean, although I didn't really checkout the rest room. Decor was very spartan.

THE FOOD: Think Chipotle style, where you get to choose between bowl, plate or a pita. You get a bang for your buck by getting a plate.  The food was tasty. We tried the Gyro and Aleppo Beef.  Had different 'Fill Its' like Rice Pilaf or Saffron Rice, Lemon Garlic Braised Kale, Fried Eggplant,  Char Grilled Tomatoes,  Tabouli Salad, Turkish Salad, Garbanzo Salad, Lentil kale salad, Glazed sweet and spicy carrots, Caramelized onions kale salad and more.  Hefty servings for the price.

THE SERVICE: Staff is very friendly and helpful. Willingly explains all your options, and lets you taste items before you pick out what you want on your plate.  Been here a few times now, and every time always felt welcome.
Great portions, awesome prices. Really fresh food and spices. Best bang for your buck!

The place is legit.  I had chicken and falafel.  The falafel was a little dry but everything else was very, very good.  Good rice.  Very good hummus.  Someone wrote it was like Mediterranean Chipotle.  It kind of is.  You build your own bowl or plate.  It is unique and really good.   The people helping are also fantastic.   I will go back when in town.  Thanks Yelp community for this find.
What an amazing alternative restaurant! Employees were so helpful with explanations, and my meal was oddly amazing - coming back for sure, and adding it to my top 5 vegan options!!!!

My favorite place to get the most delicious hummus bowl.  I try to visit this place at least once a week for lunch and I love it!  Thanks for always accepting my Yelp check in for a free iced tea. Ice tea is made fresh and is superb!

Amazing! Great customer service,  delish flavors, good price. The braised beef is a must and try the baklava.  A bit pricy but totally worth it. I come as often as possible. You will not be let down with all the choices and flavors.

The place had a nice feel to it, easy, the staff was friendly and helpful with everyone.  When I arrived there was no line but they were able to keep up with demand as the lunch rush progressed. The place filled up with people pretty quickly after I arrived. The food was very tasty. I had the salad with gyro meat, grilled veggies and hummus. All very good, would have been nice to have a 2nd pita bread, but that's just because it was so good, I had the wheat pita.

Hummus Xpress was quite the pleasant surprise.  I enjoyed the variety of options, friendly/prompt service, and the fresh quality of food. It was very affordable and a great place to lunch it up. The establishment was clean(a big deal).

I frequent this restaurant for multiple reasons.

1.) Good value. If you want a bowl, you have two options: Bowl or Plate. They're basically the same, except for the Plate is bigger and gives choice of 2 meats and 2 grilled vegetables instead of 1 meat and 1 vegetables. The Bowl is plenty of food for a meal. The Plate is almost impossible to finish in a sitting... I always have leftovers so keep this in mind when ordering.

2.) Delicious! Everything mixes together really well. My ultimate picks are: rice, double-eggplant, chicken and gyro, classic hummus, white bean salad, cucumber, beets, olives, and cheese, and double red chili garlic sauce (2nd sauce costs extra, which I usually don't pay for, but I said this was my ultimate), and white pita.  The flavor is really good, and unique. I don't know anywhere else I could buy something comparable, and I have tried other hummus-bowl type restaurants. Nothing is as good as this one.

3.) Very healthy. If you read point 2, you'll see that you get all whole ingredients with a good mix of vegetables, meat, and rice. 

I'd recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a quick, healthy meal. It's similar to Chipotle, except a better value, healthier, and a completely different flavor/cuisine.
Awesome med food, and they got the best gyros. I tried their Lamb gyro which was too good. They got variety of hummas and the way they serve food like chipotle is a good idea and different.

The food is delicious! Go! Your taste buds will thank you. So much flavor in one bowl and everything individually, every hummus, every salad is amazing. Been to Mediterranean places and paid 30 dollars for a dish and in comparison they were garbage. Staff is very friendly, helpful and welcoming. I'll be back.

Fine alternative to the area but average grub. Had the falafel bowl and was not impressed with it. Small size, small quantity and bland. Sides were dry (rice, green beans), humus was alright. Can't comment on the meat. Won't be back here but glad I tried the place.

This is one of my favorite places to go for dinner. They provide a rare combination of health and taste, tradition and innovation!

Be sure to try the creative types of hummus that they make and the garlic aoli. 

The staff is very hospitable and they will take the time to guide you through the process.

This is one of the few restaurants that will make you crave vegetables. I encourage you to try the ginger carrots, roasted eggplant, and the various ways that they prepare kale.

I have nothing but good things to say about Hummus Xpress.

Delicious!  I got the "plate". You get to pick 2 meats the gyro was tender and very flavorful and melted in my mouth, I got the jalapeño cilantro hummus and al the sides you want with a warmed up pita.  Filled me up and hit the spot!

Experienced hummus xpress for the first time tonight, and truly enjoyed the experience! The staff was very friendly and helpful and guided me through making my dish. The food was great! I am a fairly picky person and was pleased to find that I loved it! Definitely recommend!

Love everything about this place. Everything is full of flavor and mouthwatering, decently priced and super fast service. Came in lady was very sweet, everyone there is very friendly. I'll will defiantly be coming back here. Hard to find vegan friendly places hummus xpress is a keeper!

This place is awesome! They have great food and the service is always top notch. It is much like a Mediterranean Chipotle in the sense that you go down the line and choose what you would like for your bowl, plate, or pita. They offer several kinds of meat (gyro, chicken, beef, etc.), many veggies (eggplant, zucchini, kale, seasoned carrots, etc.) and tons of toppings (tabbouleh, tzatziki, garlic aioli, and more). They also have different types of hummus. Try the cilantro jalapeno - it's amazing (although my mom prefers the classic). The staff will guide you and help you choose items that go together. They've never led me astray yet. The owner is friendly, and it feels great to know you're supporting a local business. Oh, and the music they play inside is nice too. :)
The options for the bowls is unbelievable - quality ingredients and great flavor. Friendly staff dealt with me wanting to sample everything. Highly recommended for a healthy meal.
The best and yummiest of all pita places!! We have been here twice now and plan to come back for many more visits!

Yep, that's 5 stars. I've been waiting to write my 100th review for someplace special. This place is great. Very much as everyone has reported previously it's a Mediterranean Chipotle, but better.  It's a small place in an older strip mall but nice inside. You get a choice of everything. I ordered a bowl with the most beautifully marinated, tender chicken, grilled zucchini, cooked kale, a quinoa salad with garbanzos in lemony dressing, jalapeño and cilantro hummus, extra toppings and a whole wheat pita. So much food but healthy. A lot of garlic which I'm sure all of my co-workers appreciated since I ate it at my desk. But I'm fairly sure they were just jealous they weren't eating it. All this for about $8.  Highly recommend.

Kind of complicated menu but everything was tasty but I bet it could be fresher if there was more business.  Love that it's mostly vegetables! Try the beets and kale salad. This is a great option for a healthy lunch in the area. Music is a bit loud and skip the baklava.
Food is excellent!  Portions are large.  The service is fast.  The food is healthy.  The owner served us and was very passionate about his food and restaurant. Id recommend this place to anyone.

I was in the neighborhood looking for a a cheap, quick lunch. Yelp brought me here. I got the falafel bowl . Basically you can just choose what you want and then mix it all up for you. I got falafel with rice, tabouli salad, cilantro hummus and tons of veggies all for less than $8!

The owner is from Lebanon, and knows some authentic food. The place opened near my house and their sides for food are great. They cook it more authentic than other "pita" joints that just toss some kebab meat on a pita and call it a day. This is the only place that has awesome sides like tabouli salad and roasted eggplant that comes with your meal. They've been known to have live music and crazy business at lunch. Honestly, they have some of the best food and should get recognized for it!

Good tasty and lots of options for meat and veggies.  Reasonable value.  What makes this place special is the variety of veggies you can get in your meal and not heavily processed food.  Sodium in chicken and gyro was not excessive

Their hummus is not good. It was really runny, more like a soup or sauce. For $10 i got 1 scoop of red pepper hummus and 1 scoop of the jalapeno cilantro hummus and 3 pitas. Unfortunately they put both scoops of hummus in the same container and due to their watery consistency it kinda turned into a soup/glop combination of the two after my car ride home. I would rather get my hummus from the grocery store, farmer market, or Haji Babba off McClintock in Tempe.
This place never let's me down. Great food and it is clutch when you want something different.don't forget to check in to get the free tea. The egg plant here is fantastic.
First time and here and won't be the last! Very friendly and helpful service with amazing Greek/Lebanese food. Reminds me of chipotle service with great portions. Try it out
What a deal!!!! So flavorful and affordable!! Definitely going to return!! Puts pita pit and pita jungle to shame!!! The service was super fast and friendly.

I happened to notice this place as I was driving by looking for somewhere to grab lunch.  Ever since making the switch to vegan after already being gluten-free, finding something good to eat that is also convenient has been a challenge!  The name alone was enough to convince me that I should try it out and I was pleasantly surprised to find that almost everything is gluten-free and most everything (other than the meat, of course) was also vegan!  I had a bowl with veggies, hummus and salad and it was delicious!  Not to mention everyone working was super friendly and helpful!  There was even live music during lunch!  What a cool spot.  Will definitely be back!

I love Yelp for helping me find this place. Unassuming exterior, located in a strip mall, and most likely not a place I would have tried without the rave reviews on yelp. I would have missed out, big time.

It was suggested I try a bowl since it was my first visit. Layered with Saffron rice on the bottom, the guys were really generous in letting me sample a variety of items rather than limit me to what is typically included. Both lamb and chicken were good, but to me there was no contest - the lamb was melt-in-your-mouth good. Curried carrots had so much flavor, as did the kale. Grilled eggplant and tomato had fantastic char-flavor and texture. They make all their own hummus, and it was truly inspired. I went with the beet hummus since it was deliciously rich. Tahini sauce and red chile sauce made for the perfect accent.  My meal was $7.95 and included a pita. I'm a big eater but even I had leftovers. 



The format reminded me of Chipotle but the food was much more authentic and delicious. One of the guys is from Lebanon. They were genuinely grateful for my visit and I assure you, it won't be my last.

Me and my fiancée came here weekly for the longest time and quality is always top notch but when they have circulated through so many different employees it's hard to keep up with how to order. Example u get double choice of meat that would mean if u wanted only gyro meat u would get two sides before now they charge u extra for not extra when u get the bowl we gave up after being up charged a few times so sad bc the guys that used to work there were awesome! Prices are a little high I'd be willing to pay it more for the double meat if I got it :(

What a surprise! I got the bowl with jalapeno hummus and gyro with pickled veg and grilled eggplant. Every component of the dish stood on it's own and was even better together. A flavor cataclysm in your mouth.

Really good felafel, actually, the best that I've had in Arizona. Hummus is always fresh, potatoes and eggplant are awesome. The owner is always there and is so nice to everyone.  It's right by my office so it works perfect for lunch as the service is super quick. It's basically healthy food that's prepared fast. GREAT place, highly recommend it :)
Awesome food and staff. The menu is fresh and novel. Want to taste something? Just ask. Want to have them customize something? Just ask. This place is the best.
I used to frequent this joint about twice a week. Great food. I typically get the bowl with chicken or gyro meat. Only issue is they're SUPER chintzy when adding toppings. I.e. Onions, tomatoes, etc

I have eaten here 3 times now. It makes for a pretty easy healthy lunch and I like how they are open at 10:30. Chicken and hot veggies are very good. The carrots and brocolli are some of my favorites. 
Now, the store bought pita bread is tougher than most and is just ok. I have gotten better pita bread at Costco. Hummus needs more flavor and it's super thin! I think they are watering it down to make it last longer. Tzatziki sauce is ok, but pretty watered down as well. If they increased the amount of fresh ingredients and got rid of the prepackaged pita, this place would be excellent!

They were welcoming and patient with us even when they were about to close in 15 minutes. They gave us samples of all the different options, and even heated up a falafel for us to try. 

Even though they were about to close, they let us eat inside anyways. Super nice of them, thank you! 

The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable in their food. 

All the flavors are vey strong and bold. If you get the bowl, try everything separately before mixing it all together. The cilantro jalapeño hummus has a nice bite, and the chipotle hummus is great as well.

Overall, the food was very tasty and the prices were very affordable for the quality and amount of food given. Definitely worth a try!

Can I just tell you how much I LOVE THIS PLACE?

Luckily I work close by, so I come once a week.  Falafel kicks ass - so I normally get a plate with chicken.  The lemon kale is awesome - and honestly, who gets excited about kale?  The rice is so very good - I think it has sumac?  Anyway, it's delightful.  The hummus is great - I enjoy the roasted red pepper, the white bean salad and Tzatziki are lovely.  
It's a huge amount of food for $10, so get going!

Food is moderate with a modern twist, honestly had better.  A lil over priced for the quantity served on a small plate.
Although the place is clean and had friendly staff. 
Personally, I've never went back for seconds.

This place impressed me so much, that it inspired me to write my first Yelp review. 

I work about half a mile away from this place, and noticed it was newish driving by. For about 2 months, I intended to try it. Today, I finally took the plunge and walked in not knowing what to expect. 

The place is small, and there were only about 4 people sitting at tables, even though there were 3 people working behind the counter. The place is set up kinda like a Chipotle or a Qdoba - you pick the type of meal you want, and right in front of you are all the different options to include. 

I choose a bowl and filled it with both types of rice, chicken, grilled eggplant, red pepper hummus, lettuce, tomatoes, green onions, and feta. It also came with my choice of a regular pita or a whole wheat pita. Everything looked amazing! Upon my first bites I discovered it TASTED amazing. Everything was good on it's own, and it was every better when I started mixing it all together. I devoured the whole thing. It is very easy to eat healthy here, since everything is so fresh and so tasty. 

I strongly urge everyone to try this place -- they need to stay open so I can solidify it as my regular lunch spot. 

The customer service was superb too -- they explained to me how the meals worked and even let me try the hummus since I must have looked distraught over having too many options. 

My bowl and my pita rang in for less than $8. Fantastic!
It's rare that I give a place 5 stars but if you're looking for quick healthy food this is the place for you. Lots of flavor and good customer service.

The food is great and is my usual go-to whenever I am feeling Mediterranean or Lebanese. However for some reason I tried to visit last week and there was a sign on the door saying they were temporarily closed. I drove over 10 miles. Sucks because food is awesome here. Also another little complaint is sometimes they can be a little stingy with their portions, especially with the hummus and dressings. Overall tho, it doesnt stop me from going there and eating their food.

Sigh. I wanted to love this place. I wanted it to be my little Mediterranean heaven. Alas, too damn salty! I couldn't eat my food, I had to keep diluting it with sour cream, which usually won't be problematic but it didn't help. I honestly don't know if I will return...maybe once my sodium returns to a normal level.

I really liked the concept of picking your own toppings, etcetera. Each item I picked was well done and tasted great. I was impressed.  The flavor blended well together on the plate. The portion was sizable. 

I have it four stars as the meat had been sitting and was ok and the pita was reheated and dried out. 

I will go back for sure.

"Build your Own" Mediterranean bowls and plates? Why yes! Please and thank you!! I love Mediterranean food. I love the option to customize my Mediterranean food exactly how I want so I'm a fan indeed. This was my first time visit and I was so torn between ordering the bowl vs. the plate.  The lady behind the counter told me the plate is huge but carry and heats up well so I'll have plenty of leftovers. The plate comes with 2 meats and all the fixings your heart desires. The bowl comes with 2 meat + all the fixings. I went with the plate for my first visit.

I ordered the braised beef and grilled chicken plate with rice. I topped it with the following items: 

Ginger carrots, grilled eggplant, chickpeas, lemon flavored kale, sautéed onions, beets, white bean salad, cucumbers, tomatoes, roasted red pepper hummus, and tzatziki sauce. Upon first bite, I'm like Whoa! This is delicious. Upon third or fourth bite I realized I had too many flavors and textures together and it was a little strange. The braised beef was warm, the rice was warm but everything else was cold, including the chicken. The chickpeas taste like they came out of the can and into some sort of sauce. That was kinda weird but overall I enjoy it. 

On my next visit I'll leave out the tomatoes and cucumbers as they do not carry over well for leftovers and I'll probably leave off the hummus. That too taste too store bought. 

Lastly, all of the bowls and plates comes with pita bread. You can get white or wheat pita bread. It was hard as a brick. It comes rolled up in foil. It was so hard and cold that when I hit it against the table it sounded as if it was an object, not a piece of bread. It's free but skip it. You won't miss a thing!

Fabulous flavor!  Would love to see more of these restaurants around the valley!
I keep trying to come up with excuses to even drive by this place for a quick bite - quite a feat from Scottsdale but well worth the drive!

I have a couple of slogans for this place: The Mediterranean/middle eastern version of chipotle! Or Healthy fast food!
I was pleasantly surprised! Wasn't sure what to expect, and what I found was a large variety of vegetables (perfect for vegetarians or vegans), meats, toppings and of course: HUMMUS. The service was very friendly and they allowed me to taste all 6 types of hummus. The hummus options included original/unique flavors such as: beets or all-spice infused; each type was tasty in its own right. Ordered a bowl with lots of different grilled veggies, chicken, tabouli, pickled veggies as well as a very pungent yet tasty garlic aioli! I will be back!

I walked in and this place is like a pita heaven! It's line style(like chipotle) and WAY MORE TOPPING FOR YOUR FALAFEL! They have tons of meat too. But they have vegan cupcakes on deck, vegan chocolate cake, seasonal lemonade. Omg I love this place. It's not take out, it's organic and fresh and tastes authentic!

I heard about this place from some friends. I love hummus and Mediterranean food, so I figured I would check it out. The location is pretty bad. It's in a run down strip mall. I would typically not drive into this area, so don't let that scare you away!  The woman at the counter was very friendly. I informed her I was a new customer and she gave me the basic run down. I decided to get a jalapeño cilantro hummus pita. I added gyro meat and some veggies. It was delicious!!! I ate the entire thing! It was way more food than I needed, and it kept me full for hours!

My only complaint- It was a little messy, which I didn't like. It comes in a red plastic basket with a thin piece of wax paper. Since the pita was so messy, I had to use a knife and fork to eat it. The basket made this difficult. The paper ripped and exposed the basket. I would much prefer to eat off a plate.  Next time I will try a "hummus bowl."

I definitely recommend you try this place out! I will definitely be back!
I'm so glad I found this restaurant on yelp today.  Amazing food!!!  The other reviewers are right!  You won't be disappointed. :-)
Food was delicious, healthy, and fresh. Lots of vegetarian options. The owner was extremely kind and generous. Overall, a wonderful dining experience!

WOW, I have eaten some food before, but this is the most unique and therefore the BEST food I have ever eaten. I have eaten at  your  competition three times before and was already starting to get bored  of it. They lack flavor and therefore lost my interest fairly quickly. YOU GUYS ROCK!!! A new loyal customer.  I am going to bring my wife there tomorrow.

Food is very very bold here with lots of distinct flavors. Was recommended by the dudes behind the counter to go with the bowl. Comes with rice, 1 meat, 1 veggie, 1 salad and as many fix-in toppings your heart desires. Cucumbers, feta cheese, pickled radishes, and tzatziki sauce. On the side was warm pita bread. Also took advantage of the yelp check in for a free tea. 

The only thing that bothered me was the temperature inside of the restaurant. It was so warm that I felt like I had just entered a sauna. We had no choose but to order to-go.
Bowls are amazing. Had the kafta bowl with the ginger lime and cilantro hummus with lentils and cucumbers.
like a mediterranean chipotle. really good portions for the price

When you walk into this place it just smells phenomenal and reaffirms your decision to eat here. 
I got the vegetarian pita and it was so delicious. The eggplant is so tasty and the potatoes go nicely with it. The roasted red pepper hummus is great, I paired it with tzatziki sauce. So good. 
If given the chance to eat it again I would chose a different game plan (I cut into the bottom of the container with my knife- rookie mistake).

This is an amazing place to eat! It's fast, it's easy, it's cheap...but the food is plentiful, healthy and unbelievably delicious! All my co-workers looove this place and we all come here sometimes twice a week for lunch or dinner. This is the chipotle of mediterranean food, yet sooo much better! You won't be let down, I promise!

Ok, so I don't like fast food places, nor places that is fast food places but pretend not to be fast food places. Hummus express is a fast food place.. but not only do I like the food, I love the concept and the attitude of the employees. 

So I was going to a barbecue and wanted to bring some hummus. Now, I could have made it myself - but mine isn't as experimentally fantastic as what they make here. Ginger-Lemon Hummus sounds wacky, but it is so obscenely divine that one needs to test it. And talking about faith in your product when you can sample everything before you buy it. 

So I bought some hummus... only the hummus, even if the guys behind the counter told me how I could walk out with more stuff for less money if I followed their lead - but I didn't have to. Instead they gave me hummus, and I paid. WIn-WIn.

I wish there was a way I could convey how awesome i believe this place to be - it will not suit everyone, but give it a shot. Give it a lunch.. its like $6. You could get hooked like me, or you could let the world know that you are not a connoisseur of fine experimental food, but a boring old meanie-face that smells of Chicken McNuggets.

If you do take my advice, drop my name.. and they will have absolutely no idea who I am ;)   - A 6th star for the attitude of the employees.

Wow, just wow.

I came here not really knowing what to expect.  I tried it for the first time today and I already can't wait to go back.  

The layout is much like Chipotle.  The two dudes that were working were super nice and super helpful.  It was my first time so they let me try a couple things and gave me advice on what was best.

Ready for this: I ended up getting a bowl with rice, fried eggplant, some sort of broccoli, chicken, lentil kale salad, red onion, tomato, a little bit of tzatziki and jalapeno cilantro hummus.  With a wheat pita on the side.

It was nothing like I expected but oh my god it was absolutely amazing.  All of the flavors just meshed together.  You taste a little bit of everything, but it's almost like you don't taste anything separate.  You just taste one big bowl of all these different flavors formed into one.  Words really don't do this place justice.   

The one thing I will say is don't be scared to do something a little out of your comfort zone.  I told them I don't like eggplant, they had me try it and it was the best eggplant I've ever had.  Some of the stuff they have there might seem a little out there, especially for someone like me who has a very American pallet.  Don't let that scare you and trust the people that work there.

If you aren't afraid of something a little exotic, you HAVE to go here.

If you are a little afraid of exotic, you HAVE to go here.  

This is one of those places where you just can't go wrong.

First experience yesterday! It was AMAZING. Employee was extremely nice and helpful. He walked me through how this place works and described what everything in the window was. I've heard good things which is why I walked in, but I was more impressed. So so good!!!!

Awesome quick food!  I loved the beet hummus & kale onion salad.  The falafel was over cooked though but still good. 

If you don't like your food to touch then don't go here. It is all served in one bowl. 

So yummy!
Man this shit was too good I try something new with that I never would and it turned out to be amazing I'm definitely going to dine  in with them in the next few days

This place is a gem. I've been coming here for a few years now. It's one of places in Tempe where you can actually eat healthy. The staff is super friendly. The food is consistently delicious. You guys are nailing
It

i really loved my falafel pita. i was a little bit skeeeered at first to create my own, ya know, with the classic falafel pita creation being so divine. but i went for it. i added roasted beet hummus, fried eggplant, garlic aioli (put this on everything, please), tatziki and some other goodness. i went there for lunch and seriously though about going back for dinner to try another version. can't wait to go back. solid stuff.

Great concept and food. Went in for the first time tonight and got the falafel pita with eggplant and couscous. The falafel was better than most places in town but seemed to fall apart a little too easily. Will definitely be back here
This place rocks. Service and food are both great. Would definitely recommend you stop in and try it out
Meat was amazing and the concept was different. You should get the plate and have the lamb meat, soooo good.

We went by Hummus Xpress one evening and were very surprised. When we arrived, we were a little bit skeptical and debating whether or not to even go in but I'm really glad we did! This little place is pretty much like Chipotle with Mediterranean food.

I didn't really know what would taste good together so I honestly just followed the recommendations of who was making my bowl. I think I ended up with rice, chicken, cilantro jalapeño hummus, garlic herb potatoes, tabbouleh, and some toppings. My date has gotten a bowl with some fried eggplant which was delicious .. I regretted not getting that!

This place seems a little bit expensive for lunch - mostly because I normally don't want that much food anyway but it's still much less than other options. I'll be back!

Their food is packed with flavor.  A little too much for me to be honest but I still really enjoyed coming here.  The fellas behind the counter were very nice.  Awesome ingredients to choose from.  It' cool how you can pick and choose what you want in your bowl  If we are in the area we would definitely come back again!
Delicious! Quick! Easy!  So glad we tried Hummus Xpress.  My chicken pita was great but I didn't expect so many delicious salad and side options too.  Can't wait to come back again and try more

It's always fun to find a great little restaurant that serves excellent healthy food choices where the portion sizes are just right.  The protein and vegetable choices that accompany the hummus are all delicious.  The wait time on the food preparation is very short and I was able to eat here and be back to work in an hour without feeling rushed.  The price and the quality of food make this restaurant one of the best finds I have come across in the Tempe area.  

Will return (often) and would recommend to family and friends!

These guys know their stuff!  There isn't much I can say about it that hasn't already been said.  The staff is friendly, the food is very high quality and the overall experience is fantastic.  The different types of hummus are delicious, their meats are always succulent and the veggies are fresh.  What more can you ask for?  Plus they'll do whatever they can to help customize your orders to best suit your needs.  Oh, and they have the best eggplant I've ever had, and I'm not just saying that.

Fabulous find!  After an hour at REI, we were starving and told about this place. It's like a Middle Eastern Chipotle!  You can choose a pita, bowl, plate, or salad and add meat (gyros or veggies, too), vegetables, toppings, flavor of hummus and dressing.  The staff were SO friendly and helpful. The bowl was a perfect size...very filling. You can choose the "regular" flavors or some of the more authentic flavors....like Moroccan veggies. We loved it and wish we lived closer. Highly recommended!
Yum. Fast, authentic, healthy and delicious! I will be back, probably tomorrow:) Not to be missed.

This place has a really good hummus selection and the veggies and sauces they have to accompany everything is spiced and just delicious. I've been there a few times and I like my creation every time :) Good price too!
TOO frickin' die for!  PLEASE open more locations in the Valley!   Great job!

Long on my list of quick lunch places to try, I finally made it to Hummus Xpress. And, I have hence determined this is an immensely dangerous find as I work nearby and will have to give them all my lunch money in exchange for tasty Mediterranean food. 

Similar to the Chipotle-style of choosing your ingredients (and having no one to blame but yourself if the combo is questionable), you first choose between a bowl, salad, pita or plate. Then all the options begins... 

Chicken, braised beef, falafel, veggies, or gyro leads to a selection of 7 hot veggies ranging from lemon kale to fried eggplant. Then you made choice on 6 different hummus flavors (cilantro jalapeño actually has a bit of a kick!) Then salad choices (tabouli, kale onion, lentil kale) to finally finish off with an impressive array of toppings. Everything is full of flavor and cooked well, and the staff was efficient and nice. 

I'm already plotting my next bowl for my return visit.

For what it is, Hummus Xpress is fantastic.  Quick, casual, Chipotle style ordering.  And if you order a 'plate' for $10, you're really getting two or three meals.  Everything I've had here has been good or great, standouts are all the hummus, the eggplant, and the tabouli salad

Don't drive across town for it, but definitely hit them up if you're in the area

So based on the outrageous reviews I just stopped here for lunch.  They must be padding their reviews based on my experience. I ordered a pita with grilled chicken, jalapeño hummus and kale.  I also ordered a side of falafel.  The pita was ok enough.. Nothing really special with it or the chicken.  It was nice to have kale, one of my favs, as a topping.  The falafel was brought out to my table and was really dark brown turning to blackish. I tried part of one and they were disgusting.  I took them back to the counter and being full from the pita, told the guy I didn't want anything else but they should be a bit more care because the falafel was way too fried.  He promptly told me I didn't know what I was talking about.  That he's from Lebanon and has eaten falafel his whole life.  I said it's still over fried.  He then ask me if I wanted him to give it to me raw because he could do that...I turned, said 'interesting customer service here' and left.  I'd never go back and would recommend you don't either.

My friend told me about this place and I had tried their hummus before and loved it. We went tonight and I got the gyro bowl. The gyro meat was seasoned and cooked perfectly. You get to choose your meat and a grilled vegetable. Then you get to choose between 3 salads and a choice of hummus. You also get to choose your sauce and toppings. The staff is so nice and the food is so good and very fair priced. We will be back!

In the area and the reviews were great so we stopped. I am so glad we did. Great food. It's like a Mediterranean style Chipotle. Everything is fresh and tastes wonderful. We voth got bowls, and we were so full we didn't eat it all.

I am giving this place 5 stars for the food and friendly staff.  
I had a pita with hummus, rice, veggies.  The pita was fresh and soft and might be the best one I ever had.  The red pepper hummus was perfect.... Not overwhelmed by garlic as you find some restaurants serve.
The veggies were wonderful... Cooked just right.  I had a piece of baklava for dessert that was pretty good. 
The staff was genuinely friendly and very efficient.  I will definitely be back!

I would say the good is pretty alright here. There were a lot of bold flavors that I don't think I was ready for, but it was good nonetheless. Right when we got there, the two men behind the counter were very nice and welcoming. The heat though, was not welcoming. We chose to get our food to go because there was no way we could sit in that room to enjoy our meal. 
Anyways, the guys made our meal easy to choose from all the choices and were very helpful as we were first timers. If you can, get the tea. I think I enjoyed that more than the actual meal. Great service, and I can see good for others, just not my thing I don't think.

This place is such a refreshing change of pace from all the other mediterranean joints that serve the same old falafel, hummus, pita. etc. Hummus Xpress is an exciting new addition to that boring line up. 

I've been wanting to try out the restaurant  for awhile after seeing it featured in the New Times, but I rarely find myself in Tempe. I ended up taking my parents there before seeing a show at Gammage. We all left very full and happy.

The owner explained all the menu and all the offerings for the day. I got a falafel plate which was a ton of food. It comes with one veggie side, but the owner threw in a few bites of all of them so I could try them out. The falafel was fantastic, and I fell instantly in love with the spicy carrots. I got the lemon ginger and beet hummuses since those were the most unusual sounding. They were both super good, and more unique than the standard hummus I make at home.

My parents were happy with their meat based dishes. I thought it was interesting that one of the choices was brisket. Unexpected for a mediterranean place, but that's the beauty of Hummus Xpress.

Food wasn't bad.  Service was extremely slow on a slow day.  Definitely not the service at Chipotle.  The staff make it more complicated than it needs to be and basically took 20 minutes to get food with only 3 people ahead of me and at east 3 people working the line but all seemed confused.
Yummy, authentic. "Treated like a queen" ;) I had the spiciest hummus version. Lots of food. The drinks are small.

I love you.

Fresh, great food.  Great people.  What more can you ask for?

I love Mediterranean food but always struggle with what dish to order, because I want a little of each flavor from each of my favorite dishes.  Problem solved, you can get anything practically here.

Awesome food, good customer service.  
If you're unsure ask what they recommend , always good suggestions.

A coworker suggested we go here and I wanted something hearty so we ended up here. Staff was friendly and the food was amazing. I had the braised beef and chicken plate. The beef was perfect and tasted fantastic. Chicken was fine but I wasn't too thrilled with the flavor of it. The tabouli salad that I picked with the plate was very good and I had the chipotle hummus which was very rich and flavorful. The only thing that I would suggest is that a plate meal should come with two pita instead of just one. I'm from out of state but whenever I'm in the Tempe area, I plan to come here again!
One of the best places to eat in Tempe. The egg plant and garlic aoli are to die for. This place puts the "yum" back in hyummus.

Came here for a lunch stop, based on Yelp reviews obviously, and was surprised by how fresh the food was. I got the two meat plate with chicken and gyro, and I could not have been more happy. Flavor is on point, meat is not overcooked, and all the sides are readily available for whatever your Mediterranean palate desires. 
Tip: check in when you get here to get a free tea, which was also delicious.

It's like an awesome Mediterranean food Chipotle! Pick what you want for your bowl and chow down! They have excellent hummus too which is a plus since it's in their name. If you haven't tried them don't miss out. If it's been a while what are you waiting for!

Subway Mediterranean style.   A great, healthy option.

Pro's: Everything is fresh and made onsite.  No processed, pre-made foods here.

Cons: To many choices, options, combinations. But in a good way.  

I opted for a plate.  After the meat and veggies, I was in the home stretch and got stuck in the hummus selections.

Guess I'll have to come back and try a new combination next time.  ;)
One of the best places to eat in the Tempe area. Very friendly staff with a great variety of food to choose from. Very happy with my experience, will be back very soon.
This place has great vegan options, and in general has my favorite Mediterranean style food. Also they have a very friendly staff, go give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

How have I not reviewed this place yet? Coworker (vegetarian) never knew veggie dishes could taste this good, and his carnivorous partner in crime (moi) is happy with their gyro meat and sometimes crazy hummus options. A nice mix of Mediterranean inspirations- sometimes Moroccan veggies, some Greek inspired options, more Middle Eastern things, many with modern twists...all of them in a "build it your way" Chipotle-esque style. And check in for free tea! Yah! Best tabbouleh in town, p.s.

Extremely generous quantities of the most delicious vegetables, hummus, meats and other complimentary ingredients. Would recommend asking the owner for guidance on which ingredients taste best together (as you get to select and choose the combination for your meal, and there is a wide variety to choose from).  I ate here with my family and we all were totally impressed by the quality and flavor of the options (and the quantities).  Very reasonably priced, casual small setting, friendly owner.  Definitely give it a try if you have the opportunity.

My new favorite place for gyros.  They have so many fillings to choose from you will never run out of combinations.  Like other reviewers have posted, it's like chipotle but for Mediterranean food.  The food tastes great.  I tried the jalapeño hummus and was very pleased.  First time having kale in a gyro and it was very tasty.  Their tea is really good also.  They have mango, peach, and regular. This will be my go to place when I'm in town for business.

Update:  I just got a free baklava!  Flaky, sweet, buttery goodness.  Thank you!
Absolutely amazing hummus, and the guys in the truck are just the best! Polite, fun, delicious, it's a great experience all around, and the food is top notch!

Been eating here for a year or so. Consistently awesome. Fresh, healthy, delicious, and excellent value. Perfect quick lunch spot in Tempe. Wish they had the beet hummus all the time but they only use ingredients in season, which speaks to how great they are. When choosing amongst veggies, the eggplant is to die for. Can't go wrong with any of the protein options. Bravo Hummus Xpress.

I absolutely love this place. I have brought a lot of people here, and it never disappoints! The staff is friendly and the food is amazing. Warning: LOTS of garlic! But I love it. All fresh. Always good. The place is small, so if you come during a lunch rush, taking your order to go is a good option. The gyro meat is delish. The potatoes are AMAZING. Rotating variety of delicious hummus. I love the salads because the base includes kale but has romaine mixed in, too. It's a lot of food. You won't regret coming here! I do wish the pitas were served warm. That's probably my only criticism. Enjoy!

I'm constantly serching for quick healthy lunch options. This place is exactly what I was looking for!  It's basically like a Mom and Pop Chiptole with Mediterranean Food. Everything was colorful, fresh, healthy. I will be adding this to my frequent lunch spots!
Great place! Fresh food, good people behind the counter. Great option for vegetarians. Happy to have this in the neighborhood!
Everything I had here was great! The vegan options are clearly marked and they give you a lot of food for the money. If the sign says spicy believe it!

Whoever left a review and said it was like a Greek Chipotle (there were many of you) really hit the nail on the head. It's pretty much exactly like Chipotle in terms of ordering and portion sizes. (BUT they were significantly more stingy than Chipotle when you ask for more toppings.)

It's not made apparant, but you can ask for unlimited toppings at the end. It's the step after the meat and "special" veggie section, and before the sauces area. If you're confused, I'm convinced they do it on purpose.. because they don't label the "unlimited" area like the others, and there's no sign that says toppings are included. But somehow, everything else is labeled perfectly lol.

Anyways, each bowl comes with a pita, which is awesome. Also, my food tasted amazing, especially the eggplants. The eggplants were REALLY good, I highly recommend them.

It's important to note that it's a little more expensive than Chipotle. It costs about $18 for two bowls, without tip. Not really happy about that price.

Can't say I didn't love my food though. I really, really enjoyed my gyro bowl!

Went here for a quick lunch, was mightily impressed by the choices, combinations, and flavors. I chose to do a plate and selected the grilled tomatoes, lamb, and chicken schwarma. I proceeded to try the lentil salad, and other sides. There were many different types of hummus and sauces to choose from. I can't wait to come back and try the others!.

It's hard to add much more than what is already written for this restaurant, which properly backs up the high 4+ star rating (as of this review).   The owner/chef definitely cares about his food, the quality is high, the recipes amazing (the best roasted eggplant I had ever had) and the food a darn good value.   

Although I won't deduct any stars because from a food standpoint it was so good, I would suggest the following:

1.  Great concept - and well explained on the website, but the limited chalkboard menu above the food line doesn't make it abundantly clear what your options are (such as an extra veggie costing more - and if so, how much?

2.  Consider a side of hummous w/out the meat/fill-in or falaffel.  Maybe a small side to accompany a pita for 2 bucks or so.  The regular hummous I tried was amazing.  I'd gladly order a pita and then add a side to that order.

3.  Expand to the west side!  This is a great restaurant and concept - I passed by as I work not too far, but won't forever.  I will definitely miss this place when that day comes.
Chipotle meets Pita Jungle... this place is great! Get extra eggplant, it's to die for :)
This is one of my favorite lunch spots.  Have yet to have anything but a positive experience.  Staff is always friendly and the food is some of the best.

Hummus Xpress is the best.  I love the babaghanoush and the fried eggplant.  Both are to die for. My girlfriend loves the lemon kale salad.  Everything tastes fresh and it is always ready so it's quick to get your food.  They have really good pistachio baklava as well.  Definitely give it a try, you will be hooked.  I also hear they have free wifi.

I can not get over this place. The food was amazing, the service was amazing, oh and did I mention that the food was out if this world? 
Honestly was not expecting much, my boyfriend and I were hungry and wanted to try something healthier... So we went in, split a plate and a hummus bowl, and had left overs. The food was so good, we are going back again tomorrow for more. I have a feeling I will be a regular. ;)

There's been enough reviews about the style of service here, so I'll restrict this to the food and the customer service. The food is phenomenal and it's clear that care, thought, and effort are put into each item. I came here in a party of 4 and everyone cleaned their plate. With how generous their portions are, that's impressive.

There's been some complaints in these reviews about the staff being impatient. My experience is that the staff absolutely expects you to know what you want, because you're an adult, but I didn't encounter any sass or frustration from the staff. Furthermore, two of my party were real, real old. Despite being confused and difficult to deal with, the staff treated them very well and were very patient.

All in all this was a great lunch, and I'll be back soon. I expected nothing less from a guy who made me actually miss a pizzeria, and Eddie did not disappoint.

Great staff and great food. Enough options to have some variety each visit...or you can just stick to your favorite combos. My mouth's watering just thinking about today's lunch.  I'll definitely be back.
Always a delicious meal and great value for what you get. The guys are always so helpful in making recommendations, especially with unique mixing of the sauces.

Yummy food! Tried the Gyro plate with rice. Reminds me of a chipotle as they had a counter you order to chose what you want it in. Everything had so much flavor. Next time I'm planning on getting stuff on the side just to not throw the rest of the flavors off (dressing, Hummus).

These guys are the best Greek food hands down. Gyro meat is on point, incredible selection of veggies and hummus. Amazing for vegans and meat lovers alike. Definitely worth supporting this great local establishment.

Maybe I didn't pick the right things, but in a chipotle style place, it's hard to fuck it up... what I got was a buffet of mush that sounded good separated but when thrown into a bowl together became a bit too messy in my mouth. Random flavors were mixing that I did not enjoy mixing together. I can't say I would be back here again but people seem to like it because it was busy. Also they DO NOT USE SAFFRON in their rice as 15+ people in the yelp reviews have suggested... That goes to show the knowledge of Mediterranean food these people who eat here have. It is minute quick rice. And not everything yellow is saffron! Jesus! I wasn't looking for authentic but come on, they could do better than that! Their tea is good tho, I'll give them that. And service was friendly and welcoming. Suggestion to the owner: they need more seats, I felt rushed eating there because of the limited seating and people waiting for a table.
