Id suggest outdoor seating.

Delicious, fresh and healthy! Huge portions and a great deal. Do yourself a favor and get sauce on the side so you can take some to go. Everyone that worked there was nice and welcoming. Servers helped first timers figure out the menu.

So many things to love about this place.  

Food is consistently amazing - so much flavor and variety!  Every time I eat at Hummus Xpress, the owner is there on the front line preparing and serving this authentic Mediterranean cuisine.  

Very affordable spot for the quality and if I worked closer, I'd probably eat here several times a week.

Highly recommended!

Good flavors and lots of toppings to pick 
About $9 bowl pick you meat and unlimited
Toppings

My wife and I love this place.  The food is great, and service is super friendly. They are set up like a Mediterranean Chipotle.  Healthy food (yet super delicious) made just how you want it. Their hummus is some of the best in the valley. All the veggies and veggie salads are delectable.  They have tons of toppings!  You must try this place!

My boyfriend and I went not knowing what to expect and we were pleasantly surprised. Tons of options! Think Chipotle but Mediterranean and more side options. Overall VERY satisfied. Great flavors on all the different sides (again, so many options!) Looking for a good meal that's not too pricy? Hummus Xpress for sure. When I went there weren't many drink options. Canned soda and waters were all that you could purchase. I don't drink soda and sometimes water just doesn't hit the spot like a nice tea or other non-carbonated beverage would. I hope that once the business picks up this could be updated to provide other options.

It's a small place, but great menu/decor/atmosphere design inside (something I appreciate a lot).
I hope this local & original place does well.

this review is specifically for the "fresh squeezed" lemonade. it is fresh squeezed, however, that is the squeeze of a lemon juice bottle. it was so gross. I went up to purchase a soda to replace it, told the cashier about it and was not offered a replacement. oh well. the sweet potatoe hummus was awesome.

Yum, yum, yum!! Have been wanting to try this place for several months now and today I finally did. The owner walked me thru the process since it was my first time and I filled up the bowl with lots of goodies!! I can't wait to go back.....maybe tomorrow!!

This place is awesome. I went there for the first time today. I asked them how the menu combinations work, I also explained that I am vegan. They took their time to explain the menu to me, which I liked. There are so many different combinations you can throw together. Lots of meat for those that like that and plenty of fillers such as roasted veggies, salads, toppings and fantastic hummus. I got a bowl with a pita on the side. I would do a plate next time for dinner. The bowl is perfect for lunch. You get your choice of wheat or white pita.
The staff is so respectful and helpful. I will definitely make this one of my regular weekly places to eat. Very excited to have found this place!

Maybe I should've known that this wasn't my type of place, as I dread Chipotle-style assembly-line food, but I do love Mediterranean food, and Chipotle-style greek and Mediterranean seem to be all the rage these days. I have to say, though, that while I admire the number of options offered here (many more than Chipotle itself), the food didn't taste particularly authentic to me.

I chose to forego meat for falafel, and this may have been my first mistake. The falafel I got lacked the satisfying crunch I look for, and was frankly pretty bland. The pita was lacking as well, and was more the texture of grocery store pita than proper pita, which is generally far less doughy. Honestly, I let the owner recommend most of the items I chose for the bowl, as I wanted to make sure they'd go together well. They didn't, and it tasted more like a random jumble of food than a Mediterranean meal. It was certainly an ok value for the price, but that doesn't mean much when it doesn't taste that good.

I have to dock a star because we've stopped here several times when they were closed but their posted hours said they should be open. In fact, that happened three times and I didn't want to try again, but today we decided to stop in. It's a really great concept, kind of like a Mediterranean chipotle. They are super concerned about food costs and therefore quite inflexible about substitutions. I can understand, although the way the bowls are structured, it's hard to avoid certain ingredients that aren't universally liked. Overall, we really enjoyed the food. everything was super flavorful, especially the eggplant.

This place is unique. Its a chipotle style restaurant gone Mediterranean style. I ended up getting the salad with gyro meat and loaded it with all the toppings and some zucchini with jalapeno hummus and dressing on the side. It is a big salad and it left me full for hours after. It is also really tasty. I paid $9 for everything out the door which is a pretty good price considering that it left me full. All of their menu items are around the same price except if you buy a sandwich which is a little bit cheaper. 

I also used them to cater my daughters 1st birthday. For the quality this place is a bargain. Everyone loved the food. They set it all up and provided utensils, napkins, and plates. The owner, Eddie, is really nice and he goes the extra mile to make sure you are satisfied. I highly recommend this place as a place to get a quick bite or for them to help you with your catering needs.
I wish I could give it more stars! The BEST place for vegetarians/vegans! Balanced, healthy, tastiest mediterranean food ever.
Flavorful and fresh and healthy ! Trifecta ! Go here now , dont hesitate. Although it's in a strip mall,  the inside is quaint and pleasant .

I am obsessed with this place!! As a vegetarian it's hard to find convenient options that don't lack in flavor. They never disappoint and I love that they are always changing it up with new items. They are so many flavors and combinations to try, doesn't get boring.

I love this place! My boyfriend and I come here all the time and the owner always remembers us. The food is amazing with great service and a reasonable price! The falafels are made the order and the lamb melts in your mouth. Amazing Mediterranean food!
Finally someone is keeping it real in Tempe! I love what this guy is doing! If you are in the area you should go here!!!! Average price for lunch and it only takes a second to get your food.

Delicious!! We've been craving Lebanese food and are so happy that there's a place in the valley that has Lebanese dishes! Awesome concept-- can mix and match tons of middle eastern sides and dishes. All are so good. The falafel, basil cilantro hummus, rice pilaf, and shoug(?), and eggplant are so tasty. Great because you can mix and match to get lots of variety and flavor. The owner is really nice and super friendly too. An ideal place for vegetarians.

Never really go wrong at the Humms Xpress!! I love this place. It is very small inside so be prepared to meet a new friend. The food is really good. They staff are really informative and they will give you great suggestions. I personally recommend the Jalapeño Humms with tabouli salad! Give this place a try. It my not look like much on the outside but very delicious on the inside!

Went there for the first time last week. Flavors were really good!! But I only have them 3 stars based on service. I got beets on top of my pita. I get home and take my first bite but there was something rock hard I bit into. It was a raw beet. In fact all the berets in my pita were raw and rock hard. I was very disappointed. I had to sit there for a couple minutes to pick them out. I wanted to let the manager know, so I called. In fact I called FOUR times and nobody answered the phone. It went to a generic automated voicemail that said the mailbox was full. So I went online and contacted them and let them know. It said I would received a response within 72 hours. A week abd a half later, no response. I'm not saying the food I received want good, it was. But the lack of customer service and raw beets is bad.

A great restaurant hidden in Tempe.

I am a big fan of Mediterranean  cuisine so I am quite happy that I finally decided to check this place out. I ordered a bowl and had more than enough food, especially for under $10. The woman helping me was quite friendly and even more so once she found out that it was my first time in. I went with most of her recommendations (aleppo beef, jalapeño/cilantro hummus, cauliflower, etc.) and for the most part it was delicious. The piping hot pita bread (choice of regular or whole wheat) was awesome too! 

My only complaint was that the beef seemed to be mostly fat, although it was seasoned nicely. Maybe I'll try the chicken or gyro meat next time.

Planning to return very regularly!

This is a good spot if you are looking for a quick, cheap, and relatively healthy meal.  Also, while I dont eat it, the meat looks great and I saw them butchering it themselves in the back.  The chef explained that they cook it overnight at a low temperature...sounded and looked delicious.

This is also a solid spot for the vegetarians here.  Lot of options, and a lot of food-you will not leave hungry.  The reason its 4 and not 5 stars is simple: I would prefer them to give the customer the option of putting all of the different foods in seperate containers instead of meshing them alltogether in one bowl.  I would prefer to be able to taste the hummus, tzaziki, tahini, etc all seperately as they are delicious in their own right.  As it stands now, they serve it all together in one bowl and tastes fine, but you cannot differentiate between all of their different foods.

We went to Phoenix over winter break and found this gem on yelp. The food is delicious and the prices are reasonable. I got the bowl and it was very filling...even had enough left to share with the kiddos. I wish there was one here in LA.
Wow! Absolutely terrific! This is one of the best places I've eaten at in Tempe and it's really affordable. I'm going to be a regular here!

If you haven't been here, you're doing yourself a true disservice. Their hours are a little frustrating with my work schedule, but the one day a week where I actually can go, I go. The food is ALWAYS fresh. Tons of vegan options too, if that's your thing. Prices are excellent and the portions are huge. Customer service is also top notch. I've tried to find one, but I seriously do not have one knock against this place besides the hours of operation. Best food in Tempe.

Service was outstanding and the food was fresh and tasty. We shared a hummus plate with chicken on it. Loved the ability to add my favorite veggies. The jalapeño cilantro hummus has a delicious kick to it! The regular hummus with garlic was good too. It was so good, we ordered The roasted red pepper  hummus to take home for game day tomorrow. YUM

I really wish there was one in Gilbert, I would be a regular!!
Delicious and fresh! Their garlic aioli and lemon ginger hummus have me totally addicted!

Are you kidding me? How does this place have so many good reviews? The chicken is cold and old, the beef is soggy and also old,the hummus tastes worse than the one you can buy in a grocery stores, the pita is cold and hard, there was literally not a single good thing in my bowl. The only good thing about this place is that that the guy who helped us was pretty nice, but the food is absolutely disgusting.

I was blown away by the quality. Don't be fooled by the location. This is not subway or a place that uses garbage frozen food. The good in this place has flavor that can't be matched.

Do yourself a favor and give it a shot. I promise you won't regret it.

This place is like a Mediterranean Chipotle (and better). It's a small space, but it doesn't disappoint! They have a variety of hummus, meats, veggies, and sauces. They are priced the same as chipotle, but the quality of the food is better, in my opinion. Give it a try!

Came over to eat a pita bowl.  I had the chicken and gyro with jalapeño cilantro hummus which was very tasty and spicy.  The bowl was quite filling.  Come here if you like to choose your own mixes to your own personalized pita bowl.

I love this place, the have 6 different flavors of delicious hummus and lines are never too long.  the food is healthy balanced and the portions are big.  

Good Job Hummus Xpress, count with me as a frequent client  :)

I love hummus and I love "build your own" restaurants so this place is perfect!! There are a lot of options so every bowl/plate is unique. The veggies are fresh and well seasoned. I love all the sauces and the option to have a little spicy kick in my dish if I'm feeling up for it. Fast, friendly service makes this a place I'll return to often.

I was looking for a place with some vegan options and this place definitely has a lot of options for that. The lady had amazing customer service however the veggies were over salted and my falafels were overdone while I do appreciate the fact that they were fried on the spot.
I will definitely go back.

Obsessed with this place. The bowls are so good and so big because you get to add whatever In it ! The kale salad is to die for and so is the rice and hummus.  I love how you can put as much veggies as you so I always load up on those.  Been here 2 days in a row

Food is amazing. Get plate! w/ pita on the side.
Amazing....
Eggplant, Zucchini, Brazed beef, Gyro, multiple flavors of hummus specially Lemon hummus. Beets, Fetta, Potatoes. Veggies are amazing. So many options to make your own... The Garlic chili sauce has a mouth watering zing that you crave weeks later...

This place has some of the best Mediterranean food in the valley. I had a bowl which is very well served, all the toppings are fresh, you get a choice of a protein I tied the braised beef and it is excellent. Then you get to choose as many toppings as you want. I highly recommend this place.

If you're looking to grab a bite to eat in the Tempe area, I highly recommend this place! Not only does this place have thee best hummus in town, the food is always on point. I have yet to be disappointed after coming here. Food is delicious not to mention they have a lot of vegetarian and vegan options. The owners are super chill, and usually there helping out the team and always friendly. You can tell they truly care about the quality of their food and the happiness of their customers. I can say after trying every single hummus; jalapeño cilantro is still my favorite. Why would you not like this place?!

Tried this place for the first time today and wow - the flavors were out of this world! I eat a mostly vegetarian diet - so I can't give you a good review on the meat, but the vegetarian bowl was bursting with flavor. There were so many options of fresh cooked veggies, hummus and toppings to choose from I was in Greek heaven! Think of this place as a hole in the wall Greek restaurant meets Chipotle style serving. 

The ambiance leaves a lot to be desired and the signage was a bit confusing - something I really pay attention to being in the design industry. Yet all that being said, great food and friendly service. We'll be back!
Looking for Mediterranean in Tempe and stumbled onto Hummus Express. Who needs ambience when the food is this great. Excellent vegetarian and meat choices to please any palate. We'll be back!

Hummus Xpress catered a friends birthday party and w/in two days, we are on site. 

I am impressed by their build your own Mediterranean cuisine concept. The food is delicious, as if cooked fresh rather than under a hot plate on a line. 

The employees were really accommodating and satisfied our hungry and indecisive tummies.

And whoa nelly ... they aren't kidding when they say spicy ... My flavor buds are still salivating at the fresh flavors!

Now if only they had a location closer to Scottsdale (hint hint)

Hands down the best Mediterranean food in Tempe, if not the valley!  Super flavorful and authentic. Plus the employees are very friendly and helpful. The eggplant and falafel are my favorite things there. All of the hummus is delicious. So many options to choose from!
One of my favorite lunch spots. Great selection of hummus. Nice workers, good atmosphere

This place is pretty / really good. Like others reviewed it, it is like a healthier Chipolet without the upcharge on everything plus you leaving with felling of a healthy-full. 
Customer service is outstanding. I wasn't aware of a couple of item choices and they helped me out with tasters and recommendations. Money-wise, best bang for your buck.

Me and my boyfriend are avid hummus fans and have thus made it our mission to try hummus at every restaurant we can. This place is freaking amazing. Everything is delicious and full of flavor. 

Now, this place definitely has some inefficiency issues, especially when it comes to making the pita. There point of sale system is also kind of slow (and I have my suspicious about the staff).  This can be upsetting when getting to-go orders as it effects the temperature of the food. But this is my only complaint and will certainly not keep me from coming here. 

Their set up is that of a chipotle style, they press the pita at the beginning (or at least that is the intention, if you get something with pita on the side, they wait until the end which slows down the process) and you pick your sides, meat, hummus and toppings. Everything ends up being kinda mixed together but is still good. I even liked the rice, which I don't typically like but I'm having suspicions that I just inherently like Mediterranean style rice. 

*Gyro meat- great
Falafel - pretty good 
*potatoes - fantastic
*Jalapeno/Cilantro hummus - amazeballs, very spicy
*Classic hummus - Great ( I like it topped with onion, pickles and tomatoes)
Rice - delicious
Lemon-garlic hummus - a little spicy but pretty good
chipotle hummus- pretty good
*chili .. something sauce - spicy and delicious
tzaiki - great

*favorite items


***forgive spelling, since I'm writing this review in lieu of doing my homework, I'm not gonna take the extra time to look them up

I love this place! It can seem overwhelming the first time since they offer so many choices, but they are so nice and incredibly helpful that they make it super-easy. Everyone that I've taken there has loved it. Highly recommend!!!

Large portions and very fresh and flavorful.
I had a plate consisting of chicken, lamb, hummus, and several veggies and sauces.  
They have a large selection of humus and yummy dishes. Several are quite spicy so be careful.
 If I lived here I would be a regular. I just ate and I want to go back for more. Would make a great take out too.

I worked in Tempe for years and finally someone introduced me to Hummus Express.  Tons of options and food for the price.  I have brought 5 people there for the first time and they raved about it to their friends.  It is a Mediterranean version of Chipotle with more and better options

This is excellent quality Mediterranean food. I love the chipotle style ordering system and the people that work there are very nice. Meat wise the chicken and the beef are both excellent. All of the hummus choices are yummy but be mindful that the jalapeño hummus is really hot. Great food. Great service. The only thing I didn't love was the tabboleh. But it's not biggy because there is plenty to goose from.

Just went here for dinner, I don't think you can go wrong with any of the options. The gyro meat is excellent and the vegetables are great. I really enjoyed the tabouleh! Get the baklava. Perfect right after filling up.

It was okay, I got a chicken bowl w/ rice and various vegges and toppings. Everything seemed kind of old, like it was sitting out for a while. The flavors were nothing amazing. Not exactly sure how this place has 4.5 stars..
It's so easy to eat healthy when food tastes so good!

First time trying this place, and for sure won't be the last time. It was awesome! The service was awesome after telling the person who served us that this was our first. He explained in detail and let us try some samples before we bought. This place will be on our radar from now on when choosing a place to eat.
This place is so good! Lots of vegan options!!! Fresh and so flavorful. The employees are really nice too. Can't wait to come back. Great for a quick and healthy meal.
Oh yeah this place is  legit food is so bomb staff is very nice and friendly definitely worth the five stars .
Very peppy and polite servers! The food was GREAT. So full of flavor and fresh. I already can't wait till my next meal from Hummus Express!
My favorite lunch spot in Tempe! Delicious food, friendly staff, and did I mention the food is delicious!
So far the best middle eastern food I've had in Arizona. It was easy to order and you get lots of good food for the money. I'm planning to be a regular at this place.

The best Greek food in Tempe! My boyfriend and I love this place. I always get the bowl with kale-onion salad, lemon pepper broccoli, garlic herb potatoes, chicken and the cilantro jalepeno hummus. I recommend this place to anyone who likes a fast & healthy meal or to anyone who likes Greek food! Staff is so nice and always seems like they're having fun, makes for a great atmosphere!

** Updating because sometimes technology sucks **

Don't take my word for it, go try it for yourself.  The Chipotle of Mediterranean food indeed.
So good.  Chicken/rice/tabouli/veggies/hummus/feta/olives/cucumbers MMMMM.  |

I'll be back.

This is my favorite place to eat for lunch - I have an honest belief it will be the 'Chipotle' of fantastically delicious, reasonably priced, Mediterranean/Middle-East inspired cuisine within the next 5 to 10 years!  Everything tastes super fresh (try the garlic aioli!!), is incredibly filling (portions are spot-on), and did I mention it's easily less than $9 a person???  Make sure you tip well!

I'm in love with this new lunch spot!!  My first time there I ate in, not realizing the sheer volume of food I would receive.  I ate the 1/3 I could cram into my stomach and then on a whim drove 20 miles to deliver the rest of my delectable pita lunch to my flavor-loving man! I stayed while he ate and all was quiet except for frequent appreciative sighs ;).  That says it all!

Absolutely awesome concept! Tons of vegetarian and vegan options (all labeled such) for building a plate, pita sandwich or bowl.  Way too many things to list, but I chose a bowl with rice, 1 veggie, 1 hummus, and falafal served with a side of pita. 

Owner is great if you're a first timer walking you through the options and makes great suggestions. Highly recommend for lunch or dinner - seriously - GO HERE!

Yeah 5 stars.       The staff is beyond friendly and the bold flavors are a big refreshing change from the typical sandwich lunch.     

Their menu confused me a little,  it works right-to-left because their serving counter works right-to-left and I wasn't quite sure how to order..   next time will be easier now that I know how it works. 

Good for vegans and meat eaters,  they have plenty for both.

This place is pretty great.  I was thinking about Hummus Express earlier today because I plan on going tonight and I gleaked.  My mouth began water so much that I sprayed my disgusting spit all over the place like a dilophosaurus.

Dude, try the beet hummus.  It's pink and looks awful and weird but it's amazing.  Their falafel is pretty damn solid.  

I just love it, man.  I love the way it's set up.  I want more people to come and to support this awesome place.

My Friend told me about it and I visited Hummus Xpress along with her. My God Food is yummy. It has it's taste not bland at all. So I bought Hummus with fill ins i.e $3.99 and .67 on extra filling. So to plan on a budget of $5.50 I bought Hummus (Beet Flavor Hummus) with Saffron Rice, Eggplant, Olives, Feta Cheese. "What a healthy meal Ahh" .Food is delicious, fresh, higher quality food in good price. Totally worth it. If you are lucky you will receive nice greetings from Amad. His service is excellent and you will want to revisit for sure. I got the same food for "To Go" And sensible girl i.e Precious. is good and very nice too. I was taken away with Amad's service. 
The $3.99 Deal is as follows: Pick 1 in each for any extra I think it is $ 0.67 more.
1.Types of Hummus : Beet Hummus, Classic Hummus,Chipotle Hummus, Basil Parsley Hummus, Arugla Hummus, Jalapeño Hummus, Ginger Hummus
2.Types of Fillings : Saffron Rice, Beans, Eggplant, Tofu, Carrots, Meats etc
3.Types of Salad: Tabouli Salad, Kale Salad, Kale with Wheat Salad
4.Types Of Salad( Single):  Tomatoes, Olives, Beetroots, Cucumbers, Jalapeños , Bell peppers, Spring onion green leaf rounds
5.Other Filling Types: Feta Cheese, and there were 4 More 
And you get Free Pita (Wheat/White) Bread along with Hummus with Fillings. What more can you ask for ?

Overall very delicious and authentic food with excellent service.  Supper !!!
We went at 2:15 afternoon.Wasn't much busy But on earlier visit was really really full house Usually 11 till 2 very busy. Not sure about evening as of now. Try and relish food. I am sure you will love the food.

The only problem I have is that there aren't more locations.  Stumbled across this place during my work lunch break... Holy wow.  Pick a style, pick a meat, pick a veggie, pick a salad/bean, pick your hummus, pick your toppings, pick your sauce

Excellent Fast/Casual Middle Eastern Style Food featuring a variety of unique Hummus and many interesting toppings. 

It is a little confusing on how to order and is easier to understand when you read the website. The Main Menu is $6.45-$9.95. 

Your best option for sampling the most amount of offerings is "the plate" so I went for that. I walked in front of the glass front buffet and the helpful people behind the glass served. 

When you get "The Plate" They start with a really delicious Rice. You get TWO Protein Options. I went for the Flavorful Moist Brisket and the Lebanese Falafels. Since I got the brisket the Chef recommended a little Beef sauce over my rice and it was a really great suggestion. Then I got TWO vegetables Sides, yummy spicy carrots and crisp lemon broccoli. Next came Hummus and you either get one king or they split it and you get two. With all the flavors they offer I suggest getting two as I had the Beet root Hummus and the Original. You then get a salad choice and I picked Tabbouleh.

Believe it or not your not done yet.

Next are a large variety of pans of all kinds of vegetables and condiments and sauces and you pick whatever you like and get a pita too.

I picked Pickled Beets and some kind of Onion dish and really delicious Schug Sauce.

Now I'm at the end of the line and pay. Get my Cup for beverage and seat myself.

Everything was so delicious. I never had a Lebanese Style Falafel before and it seemed very different but also very good. The beef I tried was moist and flavorful and not too fatty. The rice was really, Really Good. I thought the carrots were super yummy. The pickled beets were almost crunchy with a really interesting flavor. Of course the Hummus was very good and that Schug Sauce was very aromatic and delicious. The shrug sauce had some kick to it but is a milder more herbal version of others I've tasted before but was certainly just as delicious.

Very Above Average Middle Eastern Style Food in a very casual and quick atmosphere. 

4.5 Stars

P.S. No I wasn't able to finish my plate and took 1/2 home for latter.
Food was very good but wish they would put bigger scoops in  the plates, they we're stingy with it.

I absolutely love Hummus Xpress. Hands down one of the best Mediterranean restaurants in Tempe! I eat here probably once a week and always order their bowls.The braised beef is amazing, but if I'm not feeling meat, there are also a lot of delicious vegetables to add in place of it. Always a great selection of hummus as well! For about the same price as Chipotle, you get way more choices and they don't skimp on your fillings. I would recommend this place to anyone who has a taste for Mediterranean food. Be careful though, you'll get addicted!

I've now visited hummus xpress two times, and both have been amazing! I consider myself a lover of Greek/Mediterranean/Persian food, and this place is a fresh twist on the usual vibe in these types of restaurants. ALL of the food I've tried so far is super fresh, and the hummus choices are amazing!!  The staff has been super friendly and on point both times I've visited. We are even thinking about having them cater our wedding! 

A must try.

This place is a hidden gem. It offers amazing and authentic food at an affordable price. If you like Mediterranean then hummus express is a must. Everything is always fresh and packs a punch. I have high hopes for this business. It has great potential.

UPDATE!

The guys at Hummus Xpress took my criticism of their falafel seriously.  The chef/owner remade the classic falafel into something awesome and unique.  It's now more moist, flavorful, light, and fresh.  It's truly excellent!

And I'd like to highlight their roasted, caramelized eggplant and unique pomegranate baba ganoush.

Hummus Xpress is a phenomenal Middle Eastern dining experience!

A compact lunch spot that packs a punch!

I love this place, especially their hot veggies and protein.  I normally place an order for a bowl.  Once you decide on a protein, you fill it with a veggie (I love the eggplant), pick a hummus flavor (they have 4 to choose from) and a salad.  I usually end up ordering extra veggies and you'll pay extra for it.  Top it off with a sauce and you'll see your bowl filled up pretty quickly.  Very filling and yes, you will walk out with dragon breath but it's totally worth it.  Just make sure to pack some gum or mints.  For dessert, they offer baklava and cookies.  You'll walk out thinking why you didn't come sooner.  

The place gets pretty busy at lunch but the line moves quickly so don't despair.  Parking is tight but totally worth it.  If the place runs out of seating, they will conveniently pack it to take back to work.  Go, what are you waiting for...GO!
Best food in Tempe!  Gyro is mouthwatering. Tziki sauce outrageous.  So different and healthy.  Yum!  Flavor festival.

This was my first time going here. Being stuck at a hotel all week long I wanted to try something different. I basically found this thru Yelp and the reason I went was because of the good reviews they had. 
Service: The guys there were really friendly and guided me thru the choosing process.
Food: It was great, I had the small bowl but it was enough to fill me up. Chicken had a good flavor, rice was delicious. Every bite that I took was full of flavor. If u like Spicy food the Jalapeño hummus is delicious. Lentils and garbanzos were good as well as the brocoli.
Price: affordable I only paid $8.71 for the small bowl
Cons: didnt really like the garlic sauce but then again not a big fan of garlic. The sweet tea looked old. (Only reasons I gave it a 4 star, I really wanted to get my free house brewed tea offered by Yelp). 

Food is delicious I would go back.

I have not been in for a little while but while I use to live by it I would go in once in a while.  For around $10 you can get a lot of food!  The variety is awesome and you get to pick quite a bit of it for your bowl (if you are a type of person that does not like different foods touching each other, I would not recommend it)  I love how many different flavors of hummus they have available as well and I like most of them.  Eddie I believe one of the owners is a really friendly guy and helps you make decisions and let's you try out whatever you want. I'm definitely due in for a lunch at Hummus Xpress in the very near future and I hope you get to go try it too.
First time here and it was pretty good. A lot of food. I got a "bowl" and will definitely try it again.
Great food.  Great service.  If you want to treat your taste buds this is the place to go!

The quality of food here is about as good as it gets for quick dining. This is Chipotle-style for Mediterranean food. There are many options, so I recommend reviewing the website before going in, because the staff expects you to move along quickly.

I ordered a bowl with rice, gyro meat, fried eggplant, potatoes, jalapeño hummus, tabouli salad, cucumber, tomatoes and Tzatziki sauce. It sounds like an unusual mix, but it works, and the portions are good for the price. I was happy with everything in my bowl. My brother recommended trying the chicken and chipotle hummus the next time we eat there. 

There is not much seating inside the restaurant, so you may have to order to-go during the lunch hour.

One of the best Mediterranean restaurants in Tempe. The regular plate portions are big so if you're ordering lunch I would recommend ordering the bowl unless you don't mind saving your leftovers for later.

They have a lot of healthy options for add ons and their baklavas (dessert) are delicious. Give this place a try!

This place is fantastic.  I had their bowl with beef, fried eggplant, saffron rice, classic hummus, and the kale salad.  I work close-by and plan on bringing my co-workers in.  This is definitely on the regular lunch spot rotation.  The peach-lavender tea was also lovely. Everything was very fresh.  Try it out! You won't be disappointed! 
:)

I have been here about 10 times over the last 6 months.  I love it because its fresh, healthy, and so tasty.  I now order a salad instead of a bowl b/c both come with a pita and i don't need to extra carbs.  With so many toppings and fillings, the salad is amazing.  I often pay for extra veggies b/c they are so yummy.

I love this place.  I went back to back days and brought a friend back the next day.  It's Mediterranean food with like a chipotle service model.  Think pita jungle (with actually killer authentic Mediterranean) and chipotles love child.  Prices are normal for lunch I'd say it's going to run about $10 with a drink.  The hummus is awesome though.  The jalepeño cilantro is amazing.  Love love love it
This is a really cool concept, and a very good value for the quantity and quality of food you get.

My first time at Hummus Xpress was less than a month ago. I stopped in about 30 minutes before close. The wide-eyed look of confusion on my face alerted the employees that I was a newbie. Even though it was almost closing time they were super nice. 

The employees kindly explained the whole process: the difference between sizes (bowl or plate), fillings (various hot veggies, hummus, and salads) toppings, and prices ($0.65 for additional fillings). They gave me a bunch of samples to help my indecision. Thankfully the store was pretty empty - I wouldn't suggest doing this during the lunchtime rush. There really are so many options to choose from spicy to sweet, savory, meaty or just veggies - it is totally customizable! 

So I got ALL the things!! ... er, pretty close to All THE THINGS! 

My favorites being the rice, the fried eggplant, and the lemon ginger hummus (though all the hummus has been delicious). I've been back a few times now since that first visit and each time I've ate the whole bowl in one sitting! Yup, it just that good.

Bold flavors, super fresh ingredients, and VERY friendly employees. This place is like Chipotle for Mediterranean food, without the chain restaurant feel. We stopped here after arriving at PHX and picking up our rental car at the Enterprise right down the street. We were totally starving and Yelp saved the day! We must have looked a little lost when we walked in because an employee immediately offered to walk us through the process. I ordered a bowl with saffron rice, gyro meat, roasted red pepper hummus, lentils, and lots of fresh veggies. It was absolutely delicious. And there was a check-in offer for one of their fresh brewed teas - score! All in all, this place deserves 5 stars. I would seriously eat at Hummus Xpress multiple times a week if I lived in the area.

Chipotle...um I mean Hummus Xpress.  Actually, the only reference to Chipotle is so that you understand how the ordering is done. (Because who hasn't been to a chipotle right). You start and can order a bowl, giro, or salad and then you get to make all of your wonderful selection.  

This was yummy yummy in my tummy.  Just remember to go easy on all the sauce options if your are trying to stay healthy which by the way, you can totally do here if you would like.
Coming from the taboolie mooley. I can say it's good az food. Take your photo here ginger lemon hummus. Staff is very informative and inspired.
Food was excellent, portions big, pita however was cold and hard but Hummus is definitely work checking out!
All of the food here is amazing and the service is outstanding - I would certainly recommend this place to anyone looking for really good Mediterranean food.

Tried this for the first time today with my room mate. I insisted on Burger King, and thank goodness we didn't go there! This place is authentic, tasty, cheap and filling. I'm currently rolling around in bed making whale noises because I cannot believe how much middle eastern food I just consumed. I will definitely recommend and tell all my middle eastern cuisine loving college student friends that this is the spot!!
OMG this place killed it.. outstanding grub.. unique concept and flavor bombs that tantalize the taste buds. . Oh and super friendly staff!

Their name makes them sound like a cheesy franchise, but Hummus Xpress is anything but.

Home cooked. Delicious. Fresh. Healthy. Great quick service.

Couldn't ask for more, except maybe for the falafel to be a bit tastier.

I get the chicken plate with rice, broccoli, potatoes, hummus, olives, feta and lentil and kale salad. A meal like that will cost you a little bit more than ten bucks, but is well worth it.

Pretty hip atmosphere with chipotle-style food serving.

They've got a few talented local musicians who play jazz guitar every once in awhile.
Awesome Tempe find! Fast, fresh, and delicious. We both had the bowl. Plenty of food and we both enjoyed. Build your own type of place, just like chipotle. Friendly workers too!

After we're welconed by a very friendly host we were served two tasty bowls with gyro meat.  I ventured through all the toppings and tried every single one :) So fresh and healthy I would highly recommend this place for heath focused foodies :)

I am hoping I just caught this place on a bad night...

After reading all the great reviews on this place and only living .6 miles away, we opted for takeout. I went in and if I were just giving stars for the staff and customer service I would give it 5 hands down. They were not only super helpful, but very friendly and enjoyable. 

The food... It looked good, and they way they described it was enticing, but my boyfriend and I did not like it. It is just like a Chipotle for Greek food, and very quick. Although, maybe since we eat at places that cook our food to order, we are just spoiled. Most of our food was cold, the chicken and potatoes and like I said I live less than 5 minutes away, so it wasn't he time between the restaurant and home. We did warm it in the microwave, but I ended up eating the tasty (and only hot item) wheat pita and tossing the rest. 

So, as I said earlier I am hoping this was an off night, and from my experience I wouldn't recommend, but maybe we will try again another night.

Best Mediterranean joint in Tempe, hands down! Eddie, the owner, is a master of the art, and his expertise shines at Hummus Xpress! 

The atmosphere here is comfortable and inviting. Live music, plenty of customers (but not too many), and some of the most friendly employees I've experienced. And the food is FANTASTIC! Eddie crafted an exquisite dish, with jalapeno hummus, lamb, lentil, and poached mushrooms. It was a remarkably delicious dish for only $8.50! 

Hummus Xpress is bound to take over Phoenix. This restaurant has everything you want in the perfect Mediterranean lunch spot.

We happened on this place by accident the other day. We were waiting for our car to be done at the mechanic so we wandered down Broadway, saw this place and decided to grab some food... Best accident ever! 

We were greeted by a very friendly staff, who explained how it all worked. Basically, they're a self-proclaimed Mediterranean Chipotle, but SO MUCH BETTER! 

You have a choice of a pita, a bowl or a plate. We chose a plate, and opted to share it, and it was more than enough food! You get saffron rice, and then choose your veggie (we went with grilled zucchini and kale), and your protein (chicken, falafel, gyro, beef), we chose gyro. Then you move down and pick your hummus, they usually have 3 or 4 different flavours (we went with cilantro jalapeno), and salad (we got tabouleh). But wait! You're not done yet! Then you pick your "accessories": diced onions, pickles, olives, lettuce, tomatoes, etc etc. All designed to compliment your meal. We went with diced onions, pickles and kalamata olives. 

Oh my goodness. This was seriously the best $11 I've ever spent at a restaurant. The gyros was tender and flavourful, the saffron rice was a great touch. The veggies weren't soggy. The cilantro jalapeno hummus had an amazing kick to it, and we thought it was better than most of the hummus you find at Trader Joes, AJ's, etc. The tabouleh was so bright and refreshing. The portion in the plate was perfect for the two of us to share. They didn't really skimp on anything. 

I was thoroughly impressed with the whole thing. The guys were super nice, the food was amazing and the price was more than right. 

The only downside which caused me to take away a star, was that there didn't seem to be a restroom. We thought it was a little odd, but then, we also didn't ask if there was restroom. But since there's usually a sign indicating where the potty is, and the only door led back to kitchen, it seemed safe to assume there was no where to go... if you needed to... you know... go. 

Other than that, I highly recommend Hummus Xpress!
Love it here! Great for any occasion. Employees are very cool and nice people. Stop by sometime if you're looking for something healthy.

This place is a gem. Great food, tons of flavor, and prices that don't break the bank.
I really love their eggplant... which sounds weird to say but it awesome, give it try!

Oh my gosh this place is so ridiculously delicious.  A co-worker introduced me to this place and now we eat here about once a week, it's so good that we need a weekly fix.  The ordering set up is just like Chipotle, pick how you want it served then rice, meat, veggies, sauce - all the ingredients taste fresh and it's packed with spices and flavor.  I usually stick to a pita with gyro meat and load up on the nice selection of grilled veggies.  I've never had a bad experience here but we brought along another co-worker once and she hated the food and only took a few bites.  If you don't stray from typical American food you're probably not going to like this place.

Well, I've found my new go-to lunch spot for work. So many excellent things on the menu and everything is spiced to perfection. The staff is very kind and patient to people who have no idea what they want, or have never been there before-- even during lunch rush! So glad I checked this place out!!!
Hands down the best humus and vegetables around! My new favorite place! Clean, awesome staff friendly and great music to listen too while you munch

Drove by this place & made a note to check it out.  Stopped to see what everyone on Yelp thought and that sealed the deal.  

So many options, endless combinations, and a very friendly staff.  The food was delicious and I will definitely be heading back to sample some more.  What a bargain.  I opted for the "plate" which comes with 2 proteins, 2 veggies, 1 salad, toppers, and a sauce, oh! and hummus.  I wound up with chicken, beef, roasted veggies, the kale, chopped salad, hummus, olives, pickles, pita, garlic aioli, and a pita for under $10!

This place is AH-MAZING! I've had multiple bowls there. Everything is divine and I love that you are able to make it to order right on site. Anytime that I'm in the area I can't pass this place up. Definitely check it out!

This place just created a TASTE-GASM on my tongue !

Best Mediterranean place around Tempe give this place a go !

I like this place, the food is fresh and authentic. Prices are good too think of it like a Mediterranean Chipotle style place. I always get the pita and have it topped with whatever I am feeling for lunch that day. Check it out if your'e in the neighborhood you will enjoy it.

This place is great!  I had lunch at Hummus Xpress for the first time today and I will be back for more.

I had a "bowl" and filled it with rice pilaf, gyro meat, ginger glazed carrots, jalapeno cilantro hummus, lentil kale salad and chose the whole wheat pita.  There are lot's of combinations to choose from and I will what to give them all a try.

Don't be put off by the neighborhood, it's industrial and little dated.  The food is great, the service is great, and it's easy find and to get to.  Recommended!
Excellent service Excellent food you won't be disappointed!!!!!!!!  I love this place every time I visit, friend staff and good food!!!

I'll take any excuse to trek down to Tempe just so I can eat here! They have plenty of options for everybody and their ingredients are always the freshest fresh. Been here countless times and still crave it! The jalapeño cilantro hummus is awesome!

The Chipotle of the Mediterranean. Fresh, flavorful and fast. The tea tasted like it was actually brewed in the back, not from a mix. I hadn't ever been here before, but if I lived or worked in this area I'd be a regular.

The menu was a bit confusing but essentially you choose a meat, rice, hummus and other toppings. The Yelp check in bonus was a free iced tea. The serving sizes were generous enough that I couldn't finish it all for lunch, and all of the flavors went together really well. Plenty of vegetarian and low carb options since you could trade something out for the meat or rice portions of the dish.

Staff was friendly and helpful even with a busy lunchtime crowd. I needed sugar for my tea since there wasn't any at the beverage station and someone ran into the back to get me some. Unfortunately, he came back with salt, which I dumped in and then nearly gagged at. Second time was the charm though, and the tea was great.

Never been here before, but friends picked it. Not really my type of food. The employees were extremely helpful and the food was awesome. I ate off their recommendation based of what I said I typically like so I don't remember exactly what it was. I just know I want it again.

I stumbled upon this place on yelp, saw the amazing reviews and decided I had to give-er-a-go.  The ordering process is a little confusing but the employees are very helpful. I believe the owner  made my bowl of awesome, and he was very cheery.  I was a little hesitant on how I would like the food because all of the ingredients were pretty much piled on each other, but I was very surprised that all the flavors mixed perfectly together.  I ordered the bowl and had gyro, saffron rice, roasted potatoes, onions, tomatoes, green onions, chipotle hummus, lentil salad, garbanzo beans, feta cheese and just a touch of tahini sauce.  I was starting to feel a little full halfway through the bowl, but the food was so great that I couldn't put it down.  I'll definitely be back and I'm really excited that there is finally a good restaurant in that strip mall!!!
I love this place! The food is incredible, its so fresh and delicious. I work nearby and visit frequently. Vegetarians and meat eaters will love this place!

Delicious! There was such a flavor explosion! The guys working were very friendly and helpful in my decisions. I had the red pepper and the cilantro jalapeño hummus with plenty of vegetables, and more. Recommend this place for sure!!

Best Mediterranean food on the planet! Falafel is perfect and the variety of options are endless. Love that there are always new flavors of hummus. Sad that the only location is in Tempe and hope that one day they can expand! (Come to the west side!!!!)
Just had lunch there and I was really excited about having a new lunch option....then I went to the bathroom and a cook came out and did not wash his hands...I will not be returning.
One the best lunch hangouts! Relatively inexpensive, great tasting meditterean cuisine. Fast and friendly service. Can't go wrong!

Nice large Greek style plates. The meats are well cooked with good seasoning and flavor. The pita isn't the best, so no need to ger more on the side. The side salad is worth the price and a good substitute if your going low calorie. The price is amazing for the amount of food you get. Unfortunately, i keep comparing it to Greek food in NYC, and it doesn't hold its own. Hence the 4 stars.
Use ubereats, and have it delivered right to your place. It's a great dinner for one of those at home Netflix nights. If you want $10 off your order use my code eats-mbdvx.

Pros:

- Good healthy food. 
- Lots of vegetarian and Non Veg selection.
- Friendly Staff

Cons:
- Confusing menu. Needs to be more clear about how many of what you can get from each section. My girl got 2 and I got 1 but we paid the same. Also they need more seasoning in the chicken. No salt whatsoever.

- One spoon of meat? Really for $7-$9 you give one spoon of meat? First time i went in there i got 2 spoons. There need to be consistency with meat portions. I feel like I'm getting robbed depending on whoever is working at that moment gives you the portion he thinks is appropriate for you.

-I dont know how long this place has been open for but they definitely need to clean this place up. The booths are ripped and dirty, should be aligned with the wall instead of having it in the center. There was dirt all over the floor along with a screw on the floor where we were sitting.

- There was this loud vibrating sound coming from the soda machine all this time we were there. Very annoying. Fix it guys.

All in all its a group of young guys running this place including the owner and seems like they are on the right track with their friendly service and healthy food. Just clean it up a little bit and you have  my 5 stars.

Yum! They really have some very flavorful food, I loved the rice and hummus and the chicken was seasoned and cooked so well, the falafel was my fav.  I worry about food temps, I felt a little queezy a little while after eating, but it passed very fast, and it may not have had anything to do with the meal, but I automatically thought it could have because of how the food appeared...  I won't shy away from trying again if I am in the area...
Outstanding like always and the grilled chicken pita bowl was just as good as the other meats I have tried !

We stopped in here on a Saturday afternoon on our way up to Flagstaff. Looking for something fast that wasn't fast food, and this was a hit! We were immediately greeted and served (in and out within about 5 minutes). I ordered the most delicious falafel bowl with rice, white bean salad, glazed carrots, onions, jalapeño and cilantro hummus, feta, and garlic aioli with a wheat pita. Holy flavor, Batman. Pro tip: you can get half and half of two different hummus types if you are indecisive like me. My fiancé ordered a gyro on a pita with potatoes and tzatziki, which he happily devoured. It is not the easiest thing to eat while driving (we ended up just pulling over - it was that good) but it was a great way to kick off our road trip. If I was a local, you couldn't keep me away from this place. Can't wait to pass through Tempe again just to be able to come back!!

I've been going here regularly for a year now and the standard is always 5 star. Eddie the boss treats his customers extremely well and I am always made to feel welcome. 

Not only that though, the food is gorgeous. The gyro is the best I have tasted and the cilantro jalapeño hummus is legendary. Big selection of healthy vegetables and tabouli saves any guilt. They also give you generous portions so it can be split over the day.

Always in my top places to stop by when I am on the move. Best pita place out here. Can't be compared.

I just discovered this place a couple weeks ago. Delicious food, portions are generous, staff is friendly! Everything that I've tried so far has been really good, I really like the eggplant! My wife liked it a lot too, I think this will be a new regular for us!

So I gave this place a try just because of the amazing Yelp reviews and I have to say it did not disappoint! I was on the road and between accounts so I ordered it to go. I actually got out of my car and went back inside to compliment them on the food and thank them for their amazing customer service. 
Great experience. I will be back next time in in the area!

I eat here a few times a month and the quality of their food is always consistently great.   I always get a plate, sometimes it is almost two meals depending on how hungry I am.  Totally recommend going, except on the lunches when I am in a hurry and don't want to wait in line.    ha. =)

**Vegetarian Friendly**

This place is a Mediterranean version of Chipotle! There are so many flavors and options to choose from that I was overwhelmed! I went based off the team's recommendations and didn't regret any option. The eggplant was my favorite. The hummus is made fresh and you can taste the difference compared to store bought brands. Each bowl comes with a pita on the side for free!

TIP: Can't pick which hummus to add? You can do half and half for no charge!
This place is delicious I came here for the first time today and everyone was really helpful in choosing what was good. The food itself is fresh

I go here pretty regularly (wish it was a tad closer - I would live there).  I love the plate option it is very generous and reasonably priced.  I share it with my daughter and still have some to bring home.  However, this last time I found the perfect combo for me.  Hummus bowl (classic is still my favorite) with the beef (both out of this world) and a side of tabouli.  I am so happy they changed their tabouli to the traditional bulgur wheat.  A fantastic and healthy lunch for $6 (w/o drink).

Gyro meat is good too and all the add-ons make it a perfect fit for your taste buds.  The garlic aioli is a must try.

Made my self hungry - guess I know where I'm going for lunch.

Dare I say this is the best Mediterranean food I've ever head? 

Just kidding, I haven't eaten in hours and I'm starving. Real talk: the food here is dope and prices are great. Tons of awesome and flavorful hummuses and sauces, fresh ingredients, and very friendly servers.

Come here for a satisfying, cheap and casual meal! 

DC people who find their way here - it's like an even better version of Cava.

This place is different in that it brings a quick "build your own" bowl approach to Mediterranean food.  That part I like, and what really blew my mind was how well they pulled it off.  The place is casual, rather small and they have a very simple and straight forward approach to offering a myriad of ingredients (all of which are exceptional... at least the ones I've tried.)  I found this place because they've catered a few lunches at my office and always were delicious, so I finally went there on my own today and it was quite good.  If you like garlic, hummus, really delicious gyro meat, lots of tasty and uniquely prepared veggies and sauces served up in an authentic, fast friendly yet not chainy at all way, I would say it's worth a try.  I drove from Warner and Hardy all the way up there for lunch and it will be the first of many trips.
I have been going to this place for almost two years. Absolutely the best! Tons of vegetarian options where you dont feel screwed by being a vegetarian!!

Great place! So many combinations of veggies, hummus, salads and sauces that my daughter and I can't wait to go back. She is vegan and there are so many options for her. We both had bowls with rice, eggplant, falafel, garlic hummus and the bean salad. We customized our veggies to our liking and we both had a delicious, very affordable, meal! Yum!
The food is fantastic, the prices are low, and the staff is super friendly.  This is my favorite lunch spot bar none!
It's a small place, with great customer service and most importantly really great tasting food. Can't beat it for a casual and quick bite to eat at reasonable prices.

I actually stumbled upon this place by chance.  I was looking for a place to grab a quick bite in between sessions of my daughter's swim championships.  I was going to go to the juice bar next door but it turned out to be a diet/nutrition place with a membership requirement, so I started talking to Eddie at Hummus Xpress.  He was so incredibly personable and accommodating that I had to give his restaurant a shot.  Everything smelled amazing so it made it an easier decision.

First, let me reiterate....Eddie, the owner, is forthright, honest, and incredibly nice.  As previously mentioned, the concept is like a Mediterranean Chipotle with the difference being this is locally owned and sourced food with lots of organic, vegan friendly, and fresh food.  You pick your choice of bowl, plate, or pita and then add main meat or vegetable component, added toppings such as hummus(6 kinds made fresh daily), tabouli, etc.  From there, you pick topping of sauces, hot sauces, olives, tzatziki amd more.  

Eddie will let you sample whatever you would like.  The gyro mean is so tasty but I rolled with the slow roasted braised beef.  All I can say is you must try this place, whether or not you are in the area.  It will be well worth your time.
First time visiting and everyone was very friendly. One employee walked me through each of the options and let me try everything before. I definitely recommend this place for lunch in Tempe!

I have been here twice now and each time the food has been phenomenal.  I preferred the chipotle hummus over the super popular cilantro jalapeno.   The lemon broccoli is probably the best broccoli I have ever had.  The tahini and garlic aoli sauces were divine.  I didn't particularly care for the recommended potato salad today but only because it was a flavor I'm not fond of, the quality and freshness was all there.  

One complaint.  At the expense of sounding like an old fuddy duddy...while I was there for lunch they were blasting disco music so loud I could not hear the guy taking my order or have a decent conversation with my husband.  It was fine for a bar atmosphere but too loud for a Monday lunch date.  

However, this will definitely be my weekly lunch spot for a while.

Stopped in today for the first time. 
Great Food. Great service.
You can custom design your meal, which I love.
The staff is knowledgeable, friendly and you can tell that they take pride in their work.
I will be back and I will also send others here, especially vegans and vegetarians!
Thank you for providing a much needed service to all. Good, fresh food!

It's like a salad bar of Mediterranean food. I got a bowl with rice and several different kinds of veggies, hummus, and lots of free little extras like olives. The owner was very friendly and it was super fast. My bowl came with a pita and it was super filling, meat-free, and spicy just like I like it! I resisted the baklava but I gave in to lavender iced tea. For the price it's a steal and there were two young guys playing nice soft live music. I am a huge fan and can't wait to go back!!!

Great food, simple setup, I love this place!

I discovered this place based on Yelp reviews less than 2 weeks ago, and I've already made it there a total of 3 times. This place is that good! Although I don't really care for the comparison to Chipotle in any way, they themselves describe themselves as being like Chipotle in that you get up in the line and pick out items along the way (i.e., meat, salad, veggies, etc.). There are enough choices here that the variety is practically endless.

So far, I've gotten the bowl 3 times. I've had chicken every time (I'll change that at some point). I've tried the broccoli, carrots (fantastic!), and kale--all are good. I've tried 3 of the types of hummus--cilantro jalapeno, red pepper, and one other that I can't remember right now--again, they're all excellent, and I look forward to trying the other 3. There is a variety of veggies you can put on top. Everything is fresh, and the jalapenos are always spicy. There are 5 different sauces, and the ones I've tried so far are delicious. Finally, the bowl comes with rice and a pita (white or wheat) if you so choose.

There are also pita, salad, and plate options, but the bowl has worked out so well so far that I haven't felt the need to try anything else. Along with one of the empanadas they've had available (spinach or cheese), I've had plenty of food every time I've gone.

This place really is great. I'll be a regular here.

Everything we had here was delicious!! As their name states, hummus is their specialty! All the flavors were delicious and we hear they switch out the flavors every so often so we will have to visit Arizona again to try out the others. The roasted eggplant was amazing and my boyfriend will vouch for the garlic herb potatoes. Our review is limited to what we tried but we both enjoyed the gyro meat as well. The staff there is hilarious and next time I'm letting them choose my plate, because all their selections were spot-on. A well-deserved 5 star for the food, people and local environment.

Hummus Xpress, welcome back. I've missed you. After my gripe about the salad incident, the owner made sure that things were figured out, can't knock that level of dedication to the customer. I want to be clear here, I had frequented the heck out of this place prior to that confusion. I had even gotten my coworkers hooked on it as well. I missed this place, and I am truly glad that all is back. 

This place does make good, quick, and relatively healthy food. I could, and some weeks have,  eat the eggplant in excess. It's just so good. The falafel is delicious, and has the right consistency. Sometimes falafel gets dry, or too mushy; it's a tricky thing to tame for those that are comfortable with it. HX gets it right. Not a fan of the mighty chickpea? Try some of the Aleppo Beef. It is juicy and tender, and mixes with most of the other options. Their tabbouleh is also prime. It's the best tabbouleh I've had that wasn't homemade. Finally, it is really rare for me to find good schug in Tempe. It seems like most restaurants I visit stick to the standard spicy sauces that are essentially cayenne and vinegar. Schug is a flavorful addition to the condiment family. It packs a good punch though, so take warning. I pair it with the jalapeno hummus, but that is definitely not for all. 

 
Welcome back to my regular consumption pattern. 
I've missed you.

Met a friend here for lunch after Yelping local restaurants in his area. Very pleasantly surprised to find a nice little shop with friendly helpful staff that warmly greeted me as I walked in the door! They were very kind to offer taste samples and at the ready to help as soon as I was ready.

My friend had also not been there before so it was a nice treat to try someplace new and different for him too.

Everything we tried was very tasty and freshly made! The allspice hummus was delicious and I particularly liked my eggplant and roasted potatoes with chicken in a pita!

I look forward to returning!

Their hummus truck was parked in front of my workplace. I had just come out of a very intense meeting where emotions had run high so it was a delight to see a refreshing food option curbside. The cook provided me a tasty sample with gyro meat, rice, and bean salad. I was instantly hooked. I ordered a pita with chicken, ginger carrots, bean salad, kale, feta, tomatoes, cilantro, onions, and tahini sauce. My taste buds danced in delight!

Today was my first visit here and I am obsessed already! Staff is incredibly friendly, there was live music on a Wednesday afternoon which was a nice touch. The process was explained to us (similar to chipotle style of ordering) and the combinations are endless. The ingredients are fresh as can be and the portions are perfect. I had a chicken bowl with the lentil kale salad and cilantro jalapeño hummus with a number of toppings. You get a free tea when you check in on here and I got the desert blossom black tea, delicious! I'm already looking forward to coming back.

This was one of the few Mediterranean restaurants that actually tasted authentic and home made. I will be making my way back to this spot when I'm in this city. The veggie options are great and taste amazing. Two thumbs up to this restaurant.
some of the best food I've ever had.. it's chipotle but even more amazing.. kudos to hummus xpress you guys are awesome.. serioiusly, fantastic food..

This place is so good for vegetarians on the go!  You get a lot of food for a decent price.  Whatever you get, you can customize it to make it exactly the way you want.  There's so many different veggies, sauces, hummuses, salad bases, etc.  It gets pretty damn busy around lunch time but the guys at the counter are super friendly and patient.  They always have really funny jokes, too.  The only thing is that every time I've gone here, every single thing I get is super spicy, even if it's not supposed to be.  I like spicy but sometimes I'm not in the mood.  Maybe I just got unlucky?  I'll definitely come back to find out, though!
Place is the bomb, never had a bad experience, just only wish they were open later, hopefully this place never leaves Tempe

Amazing...will be back with all my friends!   Extraordinary flavors!   Get the large bowl and have 3 meals for leftovers!  Gyro meat is the best...just plain awesome for the whole experience!   Great customer service tops it off!
Yummy, fresh, fast Mediterranean . Generous portions and friendly staff. Definitely going to visit here often.
Love this place!!! Incredible food great service! Everyone I travel to Phoenix for business I make sure to get my hummus express on!

My favorite restaurant period. I go here when ever I can't decide what I want. It's chipotle style in creation of your bowl, but much better and very flavorful every single time. I always get extra veggies and I know I'm getting good clean food each time.

Very good place to eat but I wish they would be more generous with their taboule/sauce portions, shouldn't only give the choice for one sauce because that makes the food dry and needs more of the sauce. We shouldn't have to pay extra for each sauce. Where is the Tahini sauce? Tahini sauce would be the perfect addition!!

I live right near this place and had been meaning to stop by; it is always a pleasure to see a new local business pop up. My fiance's Vegan sister was in town and we needed to get something quick and tasty after a long day. I took orders and left for my one block journey. When I arrived the two gentleman working greeted me with smiles and took some time to get to know me. Everything looked AMAZING! I told them I needed something vegan and Eddie took it upon himself to create a masterpiece of Mediterranean Vegan friendly meals. They let me sample anything I wanted and I ended up with a wonderful gyro bowl with caramelized egg plant, roasted potatoes, and so many other yummy things. I would give this place 5 stars for their customer service alone, but they have amazing food as well.

The veggie bowl is awesome.  You get to pick your toppings.  I always opt for easy rice, and lots
of eggplant, broccoli, and potatoes.  I love the selection of veggie toppings ranging from pickled veggies to kalamata olives to tabouli .  They usually have several different hummus flavors to pick from.  My personal favorites are the beet hummus, and the Jalapeño cilantro hummus.  And top it all off with a lil shug sauce, and you have yourself a fresh lunch with a lil kick of heat from the shug sauce.
Love this place. Food is very delicious and the staff some of the most friendly and personal that I've ever met

I love this place!  

They offer so many vegetarian combinations, but they have great meat choices too.  If you check in on yelp, you get a free iced tea, and it's amazing; not your typical iced tea.  

Pro's: 
Great selection of veggies
Line moves quickly
Several Spicy choices
Very friendly and helpful staff

Cons:
Parking can be tough
Small eating area, better to-go for large parties or busy hours

Keep up the great work!

I have been wanting to try this place for months, and finally tried it today. I grabbed takeout for lunch, I was in and out in under  five minutes. All the food is labeled clearly "gluten free" or "vegan" which was really cool. Everything tasted delicious and fresh, I really enjoyed my bowl( chicken, zucchini, jalapeño hummus, rice, lentil-kale salad, with bunch of different veggie toppings). Staff was friendly to me (and my daughter who was making faces at them the whole time lol) over all great experience, will be back soon.

I took my dog to the vet and I stopped by here because of the great review, best decision of my life. I've been looking for a place I can buy my hummus fresh! Their chicken was perfectly grilled, and I got two meats so the falafel was awesome too. This is the first establishment to have excellent garlic alioli sauce since I came back from Spain. I will be back!!!

Really good middle eastern food "fast"
Good, quick and healthy 
Awesome place for lunch with a lot of flavors

It was okay, nothing really amazing. I was craving Mediterranean food and found this place on Yelp. For the amount of food you get, the price is pretty good. I got the plate to share with my dad and it was huge. The pita was good. The rest was quite salty, with a kind of pickled taste to it? The people who were working were so nice though. They explained how everything worked because I was obviously clueless lol.

If you need a quick fix of Mediterranean food, come here. I've had better and am willing to wait for someone to cook my food and really enjoy it.
Mediterranean food that isn't only healthy and delicious but astonishingly affordable too. I would highly recommend this place for vegans/vegetarians on a budget.

Love the food at this place...it definitely gets busy during the weekday lunch rush so plan to wait 15+ minutes in line. They also have a tendency to put online orders ahead of customers waiting in line which I never quite understood. 

Overall, great food and nice employees just not the place  you should head if you're in a rush.

This place is INSANELY GOOD! Every item on the menu is tasty af. They have serious gluten free options as well as some vegan options. It's like a chipotle for Greek food X1000. So good. Hummus Xpress. Actually nearly fast food.
Very flavorful and huge portions to make even a guy with a big appetite full. Highly recommended!

The concept of this restaurant is comparable to Chipotle. You pick pita, bowl or plate, then you pick what goes inside.
I was really confused at first becasue the order of the menu on the wall was from right to left and not left to right. I wonder why...
The gal behind the counter realized quickly that we were new and started explaining the menu. I picked the pita option and some random ingredients I thought they would taste good together. The whole thing turned out amazing. You can ask for sauces and rice on the side.
A bonus to this place is the free iced tea check in offer. They had 3 very refreshing flavors: green, peach lavender, and mango. I took a cup to go and sipped on it for the rest of the day.

Uhm, wow! The amount of flavor they pack into a bowl here is amazing! The vegan options are so plentiful I had a hard time deciding what to get. It's a counter serve, Chipotle style fast casual "build your own" kind of place. I got a bowl with falafel, jalapeño hummus, veggies and spicy chug sauce. The spicy hummus and sauce were intense! It was also enough food for two other meals for me! 

The service was fast and friendly, and they were helpful when I was indecisive about what to get. It can be overwhelming trying to decide! I hope to return soon!
Good mediterranean bowls, created in front of you while tell the cook what to use.

Outstanding food! Gary (one part of my Dining Trio) and I were hungry after attending a conference. We were cruising by the choices on Broadway and saw "HUMMUS" on the strip mall store. That made me curious. So, we adventured into the restaurant to give it a try. Very worthwhile!

Whether you are a vegan, vegetarian or meat eater, you will find something you love here. The staff was very engaging, friendly and helpful. It took a few minutes to wrap our heads around how the choices work. You can engineer your own great meal, picking and choosing by sight what you want.

One thing: if you like falafel, try it here! It was some of the best. And I used to eat it when I traveled in the Middle East. Gary and I shared the largest plate and had a blast trying this and that, and adding this topping and that topping. The eggplant was pretty darn yummy, too.

Go in with a sense of adventure, and try the offerings. Try new tastes and open up your world to new flavors and textures. This type of food is very healthy. It was a fun dining experience and I wish Hummus were in Tucson. I'd be a regular!

What a wide array of selections they have here!  Today I got a lunch bowl with gyro meat, eggplant, rice, lentil and kale salad, cilantro and jalapeño hummus and pita.  All followed by their homemade fresh brewed mint iced tea.  For my listening pleasure they had on an oldies jazz station that played the classic - "The A Train".
You should go there either early or late if it is your first time and you are not sure what to order. The food is ok and I will go there again. Recommended:-)

If you like garlic, you'll love Hummus Xpress. They do not hold back! I don't know if it was any one item or everything but I had garlic mouth for the rest of the night. Luckily my boyfriend and I both got dinner so it was okay - haha!

But besides sweating garlic I really liked this place. I love the Chipotle-style way of doing the food. I got a bowl with rice, beef, carrots, quinoa salad, classic hummus and tahini sauce. Everything was super fresh and flavorful. Some of the beef pieces were a tad on the dry side but overall it was good. Maybe it had been sitting a while? Also, the tatziki sauce was too strong for my taste so I would skip that next time. It's a lot of food. I ate half and was full so if you're like me you can easily get two meals out of a bowl.

Boyfriend has been looking for good falafel for a while now and he said it was very good. It must have been because he ate it all before I could try any!

The guys working behind the counter were really nice too. They were very patient and explained everything to us noobs. I will definitely be back for more!

Love it. Fresh ingredients, tons of customization, vegetarian and vegan options, and most importantly, feeds my constant craving for gyros. The guy making my pita was super nice and offered tons of suggestions -- I'll definitely be back!

Solid 4.5 of 5 stars - top notch, top notch (manic clapping).

My colleague suggested we all dine here this past Friday and I'm so glad she did! It's only a 5 min drive from my office and GOOD!! 

We were going to get our lunches to go, because every table was occupied, but the stars were aligned and we got in the back bistro tables. Loud, very loud lunch crowd. Again, my ears are sensitive so the volume pains me and makes me rage, mean-mug the perps, and run outside. And choice of music was Country/Western in a Mediterranean/Middle Eastern fast food place? Errr... Nooooooo. Never, ever do that again, please. Not a fan of that genre but doesn't jive w the flavor of the joint. I need exotic sort of pop music from Lebanon or some shit...

The beautiful thing is that you build whatever you want to eat! It was a little daunting and laborious to use my brain during my lunch but I got in my flow. Tried the salad bowl with gyro meat, spicy hummus, grilled eggplant, and tzatziki sauce. Soooo wonderful; slightly different taste in every bite if you don't mix it, which is fun.

I ordered a piece of warm pita bread w salad but I think they should automatically throw this in for salad bowls... Don't you?? Haha

I'll return very soon for more dining experiences!

I saw this place for the first time tonight and turned around to see what it was about. I really enjoyed the fact that they served healthy food and veggies in a quick and easy way. The hummus was very good and the choices were many. I went with the bowl for dinner and was pleasantly full and best of all my body actually knew what it ate. i will most definatly be back.

I really enjoyed it! I got rice, chicken, zucchini, cilantro-jalapeno hummus, pickles, tomatoes and tzatziki. To me less is more, I want to be able to taste each individual element, so I passed on the lentils and other salads. Everything I had was flavorful, and I will be back for more. The iced tea was really great too. Only strange thing was I went in really wanting a pita sandwich, but was pushed into getting a bowl, because the pitas are served open faced. Would have been great to just have the meat, veggies & sauce in a pita wrap!

Good selection of fresh ingredients make for a good Medeterranian meal!

First, I like that this place isn't a chain. Many have compared it with Chipotle, because you build your email in a similar way. I would also say it's very much like Pita Bistro for the same reason. I think Pita Bistro has a greater variety, though.

Food:
My meal was very tasty. I built a bowl with gyro meat, glazed sweet & spicy carrots, classic hummus, and topped with feta cheese, mixed pickled veggies, and garlic aioli. Everything was fresh tasting. The gyro meat was good, but nothing exceptional, and the garlic aioli was quite strong, but good!

Cost:
With tax, my bowl was $8.71 - which is similar to other hummus & pita style places.

Also, I wanted to go low-carb, so I didn't want the rice that normally comes in the bowl. I was disappointed that they would not let me substitute another veggie to replace the rice.

Service: 
When I arrived there was no queue, and the staff were friendly. I told them it was my first time there, and I was clearly undecided about what to get. But the staff didn't offer any suggestions, and didn't offer any samples to help me decide. I finally asked to sample one of the hummus, which they did, but they didn't offer any other samples. Last but not least, when I ordered my toppings I mentioned the garlic aioli, but was told tersely that wasn't a topping, it was a sauce. Really? Why the attitude?

Atmosphere:
This is a typical strip-mall shop, but smaller.

Overall:
I can see I'm in the minority with my 3-star review. They have an ok selection of ingredients and ok prices, but service wasn't up to par. I enjoyed my meal, so I might give it another try if I'm in the area.

Amazing restaurant!  Love the concept of picking your own combinations of food. Great flavor and very unique!  Love all the different types of hummus, veggies, and meats.
