Great place if you are vegan or gluten free! Love their friendly staff that let's you try samples of hummus. The owner, Eddie, is passionate about the food he serves and is very hospitable.  Very tasty!!

Audio express, your home-home-home...

Just kidding. Looking for a new place to try and i chose this one from my never ending list. I walked in and sat at a table waiting for my friend and observed my surroundings. They've got a cool planter in the front with various plants which was unique. I looked through their menu and picked out what I thought would be a good combination.

When we got to the counter to order, I chose the white pita and got classic garlic hummus, flavored hummus can be overrated. They had falafel as a protein and I ordered that, which was a solid decision because they made them fresh. After that, I got roasted garlic red potato as my hot filling, lentil kale salad, and toppings: tomatoes, cucumbers, kalamata olives, green onions, pickled beets, and garlic aioli (can you tell I like garlic?) I was warned the olives were pitted and yet I still forgot and almost chomped down on one. Also I wouldn't get the beets next time, the sweet flavor threw me off. Otherwise, the mix of ingredients was tasty. I did have trouble eating the pita as the contents kept falling out, but it was fairly filling. I also got iced tea for checking in, score.

Honestly the concept of this place was strange to me, I wasn't sure if I'd like mixing all these ingredients together but it worked for the most part. Now I just need to fine tune which combos work best together.

Came here because my friends were in the mood for rice, but gotta say, the cilantro jalepeno hummus was the star of the plate we split. Went with a plate so we could try lots of different stuff all mixed together and it turned out to be a ton of food that we barely finished between two people.  All for less than 11 bucks! Love the carrots and the potatoes. The guys were super helpful and explained all of the options and gave recommendations. Will definitely be back.

Just went there for a quick lunch and the food was amazing! Very fresh and extremely flavorful. I love places that can transform healthy food into something delicious and this place has it down. Will be back.

Delicious! Lots of healthy options, and I love that I could go here every day and get something totally different. The owners are great too- really friendly, helpful and they listen to your input. When they first opened, they only had bottled teas and fountain soda- I was bummed that I couldn't get brewed iced tea. Now they have unique teas and delicious lemonade as well. Even if you think you don't like Mediterranean food you should try this place- it's great!

My husband and I were excited to try yet another mostly vegetarian restaurant (don't worry carnivores...they have meet too!)

We each got a "bowl" - I loaded mine with Falafel, saffron rice, broccoli, eggplant (YUMMMY), cilantro & jalapeno hummus, cucumbers, onions, cilantro, tzaziki(?) sauce and shung sauce...

The Falafel were REALLY good...closest I've had in the states since I ate them in Israel. The flavors of all the veggies were really nice...and it came with a pita as well

Definitely a great place to go if you like hummus and mediterranean flavors!

We will definitely return :)

A build your own bowl style restaurant with terrific Mediterranean fixings.

All of the ingredients are fresh, the flavors are amazing, and the bowl combinations are amazing! All of the employees have been super friendly and always make me smile, as the friendliness is contagious.



One of my favorite places to eat in Tempe.

Delicious and filling.  I had the small bowl and although it looked small a first, once you start piling the toppings it becomes a large salad!  The employees were nice and one walked me through the options and was patient as I reviewed what everything was.  It was filling and I even had leftovers.

When I think of Vegetarian food I think of Hummus Xpress. The food here inspires me.  

If I had access to this spot everyday, I would be encouraged to cross over to vegetarianism and feel like I didn't miss out on eating meat. The food is seriously that delicious. 

Favorites: 

All of the Hummus's! They have flavored hummus that they rotate.  Everyone's fav cilantro jalepeno-a bit too spicy for me. My favorite is the Roasted beet hummus which has a beautiful hot pink color. They are so creative with their hummus! 

Eggplant- roasted, creamy, complex and divine! 
 
Roasted broccoli- flavorfully rich roasted goodness

Falaffel- soft fluffy insides with a crunchy exterior and unexpected hint of cardamom 

Kale salad- fresh and zingy 

$9 for a bowl filled to the brim with diverse veggie goodness. 


Forget all the fancy Vegetarian/Vegan places in LA.  I'll take the excellently prepared recipes here, over the fancy pretentious, outrageously priced stuff any day.

I am half way done eating my meal and I couldn't yelp this place fast enough!  I got a plate with beef and gyro.  The beef was a recommendation by a employee.  The beef was/is AMAZING!  The meats were all warm.  The carrots were spicy and delish!  They gave me a ton of kalamata olives which I LOVE.  The portions are beyond generous.  

This place is top notch and I will definitely be back!

I love this place! It's like chipotle, except you make a pita instead of a burrito! Everything is fresh and delicious, and the owner and staff are super nice and explain it all very well. Thanks for giving Tempe some more vegetarian options!
Now a weekly spot after my first visit.  Fantastic, fresh & authentic Mediterranean food at unbelievable prices. Highly recommend

This is an awesome place. Was visiting the Phoenix area for work and saw the high rating on Yelp so I had to stop in. The food was delicious and fresh, seemed better than the other Mediterranean restaurant we checked out (Pita Jungle). All in all I would come back again.

I got a bowl. There is a good variety of options for meat and vegetarian entrees. Flavor for saffron rice, tabouleh, and gyro good. The texture to the gyro meat was a bit mushy, like it had been sitting the steamer bin for a long time. The grilled eggplant was more on the burnt than grilled. Classic hummus was spot on, good. My visit was at a little after 130pm. 

The foil bowl is deceiving in how filling it is. Filled with a meat or veggie entree, rice, salad, veggie side, hummus and a pita!

Would be willing to go back, try some other options like falafel and the lentil salad.

Service was nice. She asked if I had ever been there before. And since it was my first time she walked me through ordering.

This was my first time eating hummus like this.  Food was amazing! Very clean, and very friendly.  I highly recommend you eat here without delay. Savory, exploding with flavor and a hint of spice! I love this place! My new MUST EAT AT places in Tempe, AZ.!!

Finally remembered to try this place, and I should have done it sooner.

Staff:  Insanely friendly and helpful

Selection: Pretty much have everything.  Tons of options for the gluten-free, vegetarian, or us carnivores.  I enjoy the vegetarian options as a change up and this place has variety to fit a wide array of tastes.

Food:  I was a bit overwhelmed by the options so there was no method to my madness.  It really was delicious and the portions were huge.  I went with the Gyro, some kale veggie, the basil hummus, rice, etc, etc.... too much to list.  I went with the bowl while my gf went with the salad.  

This place blew us away in all aspects.  Definitely plan on going back.  Only mini critique is to stay open later for us dinner procrastinators!

Build a hummus bowl with your favorite grains and veggies? Um, yes please. This place is just awesome - the food is delicious, the staff is seriously nice, and it's very friendly to people who are veg or vegan or GF. It's also a great amount of food for the price. This is one of those restaurants that just makes you feel good after you eat there. 

Bonus: I know 99.99999% of the population doesn't care about the celery content of their food, but I am severely allergic and it was a huge relief to be told no celery is used anywhere here!

This used to be my favorite place. They are getting a bit stingy with their food. Quite expensive for the amount you get. Still hungry after I ate. They used to fill u up!!

Well the owners care about their customers! Addressed the issue properly! I hope they can maintain serving size!

I eat here about twice a week. Eddie, the owner and chef, is super passionate about his food, and he and the whole crew are always friendly. Every meal I've ordered has been delicious and fresh. I love the different hummus options, and the falafel is really special with lots of herbs. The food is served Chipotle style, with lots of different fillers and toppings. Eat here, you will not regret it!
I have been here a couple of times now and love the variety of food and its very filling.

Wow! This place has PER-SON-NAL-I-TY!

The guys that cook, serve and own this place are REALLY nice guys, and the food is VERY authentic.  For people who have a 100% Americanized palate, it might be a tad different for your tastes, but if you like meat, no meat, hummus, no hummus, tzatziki (sp?), or veggies, you should definitely stop by.  

To be honest, the food is really great, but it's the personalities of the people that work there that will keep me coming back.  I KNOW that I will leave in a good mood after having lunch there. :)

Wow - huge portions! Great selection for vegetarian & vegan eaters. The staff was friendly & the service was super quick since we were the only ones there at the time (I hope business keeps picking up b/c this place is awesome!). The food was fresh & healthy. I'll definitely be back!

On the regular lunch rotation, I love this place.  When you need a healthy, fulfilling meal, and on a budget?  This is the place.  The price and the amount of food you get is a super deal.  Beats the big business burrito places and even the smaller gyro stops.  

I always get a pita with no rice.  It doesn't matter the hummus and veggie selection as they are all freshly made.  Tabouli is the salad of choice but I have tried the Mediterranean salad and I was impressed.  Unlimited toppings smothered with your choice of sauce.  I go with the Tzatziki but you had me at unlimited toppings.

Like I said, need a fulfilling meal but not that unhealthy stuff?  Go here!!!  On a budget and willing to try something new?  Go here!!!  I have...multiple times.

Delicious. Fresh. Huge portions...you could probably split with someone. 

Good stuff.
Honestly. Go here if you care about eating great tasting, healthy food and supporting a unique local business. It's like chipotle for Mediterranean food. Delicious.
This place is really good and authentic for $10 I had a huge plate of food the owner remembered us from our last visit. The beef brisket was amazing. This place is 5 stars all day.
you can make your own bowl alot of variety and its really tasty owners are friendly

We found this place through yelp, love holes in the wall, personalized service intimate and cozy...nope! Not this place.
We were rudely greeted (if you can call it a greeting) by the owner, who had an attitude,  told us to order right away or move out the way. I would have understood if the place was packed and we took longer than a minute to check out the menu. But nope! No one was behind us and we had just arrived.  
We told him we were ready and aparently this bothered him since he asked us 3 questions in this order. 1. Is this your first time here? We said yes. 2. Do you have any questions?  Not yet, but we're ready to order. And #3 you should have questions,  this is your last chance.  We looked at each other thinking is this guy on drugs?? Cause he was hyped and angry....well who knows...we ordered the gyros.
Don't care for the food. It was bland and they force you to add sides you didn't want. Who puts rice on a gyro??? 
I've had great Mediterranean and that was not it. Although bland the food was cooked right and there were some healthy choices.
I would consider this place probably a modernized or westernized Chipotle style Mediterranean restaurant.
So if you want classic, look else where.

Their food truck came to my office complex yesterday for the first time so I decided to give them a try. I ordered the gyro bowl but am trying to do low carb right now so I got it without the rice. To my surprise it also came with a piece of pita bread. Well of course I ate that because I am not going to say no to pita if it is right in front of me. Overall the meat and veggies tasted great; I really loved that each had it's own unique flavoring. I ordered the eggplant and carrots for my two veggie options but he offered to give me a third since they were hardly any carrots left so I also got kale. Unfortunately the kale was a bit watery, even though it tasted amazing, and so that sort of diluted the hummus. So the consistency was a bit off but the red pepper hummus was still delicious. I really enjoyed my meal and I hope that the truck comes back again.

I was only in Phoenix two days and ate here twice, that should tell you something! Pick a pita, bowl, or plate and call out your favorites. You get proteins, vegetables, rice, hummus and add ons and sauces, so lots of possible combinations. The falafel were great, fried eggplant was friggin' delicious. Hummus came in at least six different flavors, I tried the chipotle and roasted red pepper, both were fantastic. Tabbouleh fresh, lentil kale salad was off the chain. Service at the counter was above average. Maybe i need to move to Phoenix.

Excellent service and amazing food. I stopped by on my way back to the office and didn't expect much of it. This place blew me away. From the moment I walked in. These guys were courteous and was patient as I make my decision on what to eat. Everything was flavorful. Don't think twice, just stop in!!!! 

You have to try their falafel! Delish!

Mediterranean food is almost binary. Its either great or its terrible. After having had some really amazing experiences at other places, it feels a little harsh to dig into Hummus express, but there's so many ways that it felt uninspiring. Its definitely got potential, but it falls short in too many places. The customer service is good, and they have some good toppings and sauces, but you're limited to just 1 sauce. The meat is hit or miss depending on what you get.

If I'm getting a platter/plate, I safely assume that the rice that is served should be decent. How a Mediterranean food restaurant fails to execute rice is beyond my belief. At 6 pm, you can't blame the lack of customers for rice that seemed not only stale but completely overcooked. It looked like couscous, but tasted mushy like mashed potatoes. The chicken was decent, and the gyro actually had great taste and texture. However, the braised beef reminded me of a bland pot roast that was undercooked leaving it tough and chewy. I thought it was peculiar this was even an item at this place, but I would definitely stay away from that one. 

There's plenty of fresh, high-quality toppings to choose from, but they are a little stingy with them. You get a very small pinch of each thing making it similar to a sampler. The eggplant tastes great and was one of the few toppings they didn't hold back on. Meanwhile though, the sauces were plagued by the same thing exhibited by the toppings. I don't quite understand why you're limited to one sauce when most other places let you try as many as you want, within reason of course.

At the moment, I can't really recommend this place. Its good, but has far too many holes to patch up. The service is excellent, and I'm sure they'll turn it around. I just don't think it fits my tastes.

Design your own meal! I love it. Hummus Xpress offers fast, fresh options that are a lot healthier than what you'd normally consider as "fast food." You start with your choice of wrapping or container such as pita, bowl, or plate. You get seasoned rice automatically with your order, and can then choose your meaty protein, falafel, or go veg where you can double up on each section. There are various delicious vegetables to choose from, several hummus flavors, salads, and a last section of condiments and sauce to finish your creation.

I opted for a vegetarian bowl with grilled eggplant, ginger carrots, beet and classic hummus, lentil salad, white bean salad, marinated onion with carrot, chickpeas, and garlic aioli to top it off. Quite a lot of food for a bowl! Each component was full flavored and went well with each other. My favorites of the bowl were the ginger carrots, eggplant, and beet hummus. As a side note, be aware that the garlic aioli is delicious but is made with raw garlic so you will have stinky dragonfire breath if you get it :).

Service was very friendly and cheerful. The space is small so it might be cramped if you go with a large group. 

Overall I love the concept and the food is fresh, fast, and flavorful. I'll definitely be back again!

Wife and I were headed on foot to another restaurant when we walked by Hummus Xpress.  We both love Mediterranean cuisine, but were reluctant to try it because it looked too "fast food," and we were looking for table service.  We are so thrilled we decided to give it a try.

Fresh and delicious doesn't quite do it justice.  The flavors were sensational, the ingredients many and varied, the choices, Pita, Bowl, Plate or Salad, gave us many options, each made to order, all focused on homemade middle-eastern favorites, such as tabbouleh, tzatziki, eggplant, pickled vegetables, spicy chicken, simmered beef, gyro, kalamata olives, chickpeas, and of course, fresh, homemade hummus in four flavors.  Every one was delicious.  We awarded HX five stars despite occasional, brief objectionable background music.  We will definitely return.

Not only is the food absolutely delicious, The service is absolutely incredible. Even though we no longer live in Tempe, we make an extra special trip just to come here. The food is authentic and their vegetable selection it offers a wide variety. I love the cilantro hummus and the beet hummus.  The service though is top notch. The staff is so friendly and helped my nine-year-old son choose the best stuff for his plate. We will be back time and time again. We love you Hummus Xpress!!!!

The food here is great, I've never had a problem with any of the staff and they are super helpful. As a vegan/vegetarian they know which of the their product fits my diet. My only gripe is that they need bigger water cups, but that won't stop me from coming. Keep up the good work Hummus Xpress!

I think we have an up and coming Yelp favorite everyone! They have only been open a short time but the quality of the food is quite good. They have it set up so that one  goes through it in sort of an operational line, picking the items one wants in the pita, bowl or the dinner plate size, and the food is basically Lebanese. 

The seasoned rice (yes, I forgot what it is called) is amazing and for vegetarians there is a bevy of no-meat options. I did try the gyros meet with the dinner size option but the grilled eggplant is also quite good. They also have a seasonal veggie option and the day I went it was rainbow kale - kale, how cool is that one folks!

I plan to go back and update my review after a few times but right now I would say this is a culinary gem located, as Juan B notes, in a strip mall, but that is sometimes where you find the best eating experiences, right? Looks like, based on Kory L's review, that I will have to try the falafel next time, sounds delicious! :-)

Mmm! MMM! Love this place and love the concept. The food is fresh, flavorful, and fantastic! I like to get a bowl with rice, gyro meat, glazed carrots, eggplant, tzatziki, and shug with a pita on the side. Your belly will thank you after! The owner/chef puts his passion for food in his choices and you can tell in the service and taste. I hope they open more around the Valley!

Update- The last two times I have been here and ordered my meal to go, I have unfortunately found hair in my food both times. I really love the food, but finding hair in your food really ruins it. Hummus Xpress I love you, but please be more careful when preparing and serving your food!

I eat here almost every day for lunch, and can't get enough. The flavor packed in every bite is outstanding!  It's the best Mediterranean food in town, and with the Chipotle style serving, your in and out quick.

Service 5/5: owner and employees were very helpful and genuine. 

Food 5/5: I am Lebanese and while my family does some dishes slightly different it is overall really good. I respect the fact that they don't hold back on garlic in the hummos    

Overall experience 5/5: they really made the place look nice from what it previously was, food and service very good
Always fresh and tasty. Great options for vegetarian and non-vegetarians alike. The pita is overflowing and the grilled veggies are awesome.

This food is AWESOME!!!
Got this delivered to my office through Foodsley and couldn't have been happier.
I ordered a bowl with gyro meat, grilled zucchini, carrots, ginger lemon hummus, feta cheese and a garlic aioli. SO GOOD!!!
Can't wait to eat from this menu again. May have to just go to the place myself!

The Veggie Bowl is the way to go. But the Gyro is delicious also. I have been here a handful of times and I'm always happy with my choices. The service is outstanding, the food is fresh and the prices are amazing! Don't miss this place. It's worth the stop.
delicious!!! and I ordered through uber eats and they put a personalized note in my to go order. great little touch. I will 100% order from here again!

I love Mediterranean cuisine and I have tried quite a few places in Phoenix that serve Mediterranean cuisine and out of all those places Hummus xpress is on the top of my list. It's chipotle style serving is amazing. Their saffron rice is out of this world. It's a must visit if u are in Phoenix or visiting.

The food tasted amazing! I love how they have signs next to the food that tells me what is vegan. They give you tons of food! I always have leftovers on top of great costumer service every time! I definitely recommend this place to anyone!

Very customizable. If you want to go simple the chicken, original hummus, and olives are a great choice. But there are so many options to spice up your bowl. The owner helps you through the process of choosing your meats, sides, and sauces very patiently. You can tell he is proud of the food that is put out, as he should be. A distinction between this place and any other restaurant is that the flavors are from real spices and herbs, not just sugar and salt.

I ordered delivery through Uber eats.  Food was delivered quickly, but incomplete.  Ordered baklava, waters, extra protein and sauce and didn't get it.  The food itself tasted good, no complaints there, but disappointing that my order was wrong.
This place is awesome. So many healthy and tasty options.  It's set up like a Chipotle where you select what you want as they are plating it up.   This is a new regular place for me.

I don't know what I am more mad about, the waste of calories or he waste of money. 8$ for a "bowl" of pretty much 3 pieces of vegetable. They don't even half fill the contact, it's unbelievable. I feel like I just ate a salt stick. I can not believe the reviews for this place. Pita bistro is so much better than this place it is ridiculous. Never ever again.

Hummus Express has the feel of a neighborhood cafe with more authentic fare. I come here on about a weekly basis. By far the best gyro meat I've ever had. Apparently, the trick is to marinate. I usually get a bowl, which seems quite reasonable price-wise given the amount of food. I am also quite fond of the grilled eggplant.

Many options to choose from, great quality and everything is made fresh. Staff is very helpful and gives great advice on what to mix and match. You have to try everything and try different combos. Very clean and always kinda busy for lunch. Gyro meat could be sliced a little thinner but oh well. I see people comparing this place to Chipotle...same concept, sure, but like any other "assembly line" food places, YOU pick what you want. If your bowl didn't come out to your liking, uhh, hello, your fault. Unless you're complaining about the actual quality/flavor of the food, comparing Hummus Xpress to Chipotle is pointless.

I really enjoy the fresh taste and the atmosphere ! The restaurant is always clean warm and inviting and not  crowded either  .The idea of the way you order is like Chipotle .  You start with a pita of your choice white or wheat then have the employees pile what ever sounds good to you .The cooked veggies I am not a fan of but everything else is fresh light and delicious ! The employees are always friendly and will let your try samples before giving you a generous spoon full .The different hummus choices sound odd but once you try them you'll be hooked !! I like getting alot of food for a good price and this place is great for the amount you get .  My only complaint is my husband and I  tried the baklava once it was really rich and flaky like it was supposed to be but a bit over priced for such a tiny piece.One day I will have to try the falafals . My only wish is that my current apartment was closer ;) so I could eat it more often .All in all if your looking for something fresh different and something your gluten free , vegetarian or carnivore people in your life will like this is a great hole in the wall !

Actually, Middle Eastern food is one of our favorites, and we will probably be back -- if we happen to pass by at lunch time, and we are hungry.  But there is nothing about Hummus Xpress that would make it worth a trip.

Like the others of its genre, epitomized by Chipotle Mexican Grill, Hummus Xpress allows you to choose from four presentations (basically the container you want the food served in), four proteins, and various sides.  They build your meal in your container, you pay at the register, find a table, and sit down to enjoy -- well, to enjoy some of it.

The location is small and basic, which is okay, but what is not okay is problems with the food.  The gyro meat, for example, was far too thickly cut so that it did not get that crispy caramelized crust on the outside, and it was luke warm.  The spicy carrots were unevenly cooked, with many pieces raw and others mushy.  The signature hummus was nowhere near as good as the Sabra variety you can buy at a grocery store.  And the pita was dull, cold, and generally substandard.  Some items were quite good, however, such as the braised beef (brisket), kale salad and rice.  

But taken on balance, the food is just average.  Hummus Xpress does not rate four or five stars, no matter what standard you judge it by.

I love Greek Food! So when I found out we were catering in for a work meeting I was excited to try something new. 

It was a little difficult navigating the menu that we had, post card sized, and didn't list all the options and had some options listed that were not available any longer. Not to worry though, the manger was very helpful in breaking it all down. 

We ordered a lot of food, pretty much min one of everything and doubled up on a few others. We had lamb, and chicken and falafel, and 6 kinds of hummus, and sauces galore. They delivered right on time, helped me get everything set up, they provided all the utensils and plates, and were very nice. Everything tasted super fresh and I am pretty sure we ate happily for at least two days. 

I have yet to stop in to the location for a single meal, but next time I am in the area I will surely try. Highly recommend for your office event.
One of our favorite spots for some good vegan food. The fried eggplant is amazing!! Love the variety of choices and everything tastes awesome together.
Great service! Happy people! We ordered 2 vegan lunch specials and everyone was so helpful. The food was delicious and huge portions. Thank you!
Awesome food!  A great find!  Roll your own plates with fresh, perfectly spiced food.

I need to Xpress my appreciation for this place.

Hummus Xpress is all about cafeteria-style, mix and match Mediterranean food.  You start with a plate, a bowl, or a pita, then pick a meat (or an non-meat, or no meat), some veggies (lots of choices), some hummus (or not) and then a salad and rice (or not), and then maybe a sauce (or not).  Do it yourself--get a lot of a little or a little of a lot--however you want it.  There's always many choices.

Their hummus is shot through with kale and cilantro--enough to add greens and a little spice, but not too much.  Falafel?  Fala-full of flavor.  Nothing is pre-made, EVERYTHING is fresh.  Great taste, great price, nice and fast, extreme service.  Good for lunch or dinner or a snack.  Veggie friendly.

Work nearby? Lunch.  Live nearby?  They deliver.  Do it.

Hummus Xpress is legit! One of the best fast-casual restaurants in the Valley. Metro Phoenix is lousy with Mediterranean restaurants, and that's a good thing. I had a conversation with the owner about this, and we both agreed that Pita Jungle played a big part in spreading the growing acceptance and consumer love for this delicious cuisine. 

The Mediterranean restaurants in town are all pretty damn good for the most part. I would be hard-pressed to pick a favorite. This one is right up there at the top of the list. In fact, I may just go ahead and make a list. 

The way you order here is similar to eating at Chipotle or Q-doba, but instead of tortillas you're getting a pita and different fixings... except cheese. Pretty much everything you could pile onto a plate here is healthy, and it's all fresh. This would definitely make this a great place to try as your first foray into this type of food if you're a virgin.

The kitchen is immaculate and you can see it all from the dining room. The service is friendly and quick. And of course, the food is fresh and absolutely delicious. Since you get to pick what you want to eat, if you don't like it - it's pretty much your fault. I had a pita with beef and fixings, while my girlfriend had a chicken plate (which also comes with a pita, but you get extra protein). We both ate ourselves stuffed. 

This strip used to be kinda dead - this spot used to be an always-empty Chinese place where the owner didn't give a shit anymore, but the new owner cleared out all remnants of what it used to be and transformed it into something great. The neighbor at Detroit Coney Grill did the same thing, and now this strip is bustling. 

Hummus Xpress delivers (like actually delivers food to your door), so there's really no excuse to not try it. It was easy to give 5 stars here... I love this place. I will most definitely be back.

Delicious! I eat here whenever I'm in town. They offer different types of hummus and you can mix and match what's added to your dish. My favorite place for Mediterranean food. Very friendly and helpful staff.

The pita bowls are delicious! I recommend the jalapeño cilantro hummus with chicken on a wheat pita! I loved the potatoes for my vegetable option. Then top it off with garlic aioli! My only complaint is that they close too early!

Thought this place was ok. It's a cool concept. Wasn't a fan of the Tahiti sauce... Had absolutely no flavor. Some items in my bowl were super hot and others cold. Lots of overpowering flavors but I'd probably be back.
Always FANTASTIC FOOD! Never have I had a bad meal or an unpleasant experience.  Always delicious! The Braised beef with spicy carrots are a must!!!

Chipotle meets the Mediterranean! You choose your portion size, meat (gyro, beef, chicken, or for our vegetarian friends, falafel) and bountiful toppings. When they ask if you want rice, YOU GIVE AN EMPHATIC 'YES' - the saffron rice is amazing.

At the end of the counter you have a generous portion of fresh, flavorful food. I love that they have multiple varieties of hummus every day (to be expected given the name), and each that I've tried so far is delicious. It's a good thing the flavors meld, because there isn't enough room in the bowl for it all without selections overlapping or stacking (i.e. hummus over your rice). This could be a minus to some folks.

A heads up - the parking is lousy (it is in a strip mall) and there aren't many seats inside. The soda is reasonably priced and has free refills, but only comes in one size, 12 ounce, which bugs my wife. Skip it for takeout and swing by Circle K.
This place rocks! Just enjoyed a terrific lunch, I will be back on a regular basis. You will not be disappointed in the food here a can't miss.

We went here on a recommendation from someone else, and at one point my wife even said she was upset it took us so long to find this place.  Food was good, staff was friendly, and for the amount of food you get, the price is very reasonable.  We'll be back.

Also, they told us they're open until 9 PM on weekends, and they deliver now.  So don't trust the hours above.
I just had a ton of Hummus Xpress food at the Vegan Festival in Phoenix. The food was amazing! Truly! The guys preparing the food were so great. Don't miss out!

Yum!!! This place is awesome. A vegan hidden gem!! Excellent selection of add ons at no additional charge. The guy working there, possibly an owner, was very down to earth, made great suggestions and friendly. Definitely coming here again. The food was AMAZING!!

My experience is based on their food truck. I couldn't  finish the chicken hummus bowl I I ordered. Very messy and quickly thrown together, rubbery chicken that wasn't well seasoned (pretty sure it came from a can), mushy carrots, and I couldn't even find the hummus and rice. I'll chalk it up to them not being prepared for a large lunch rush, but they didn't serve anything that would make me a returning customer. Disappointing dish after waiting so long in line.
This place is great. Food tastes great and it's super fast. It's popular so you might want to come just before or just after lunch hour.
Nothing fancy, just quality food at an affordable price. Hummus for days. Really great service.
Just YES! These ginger carrots I had in my bowl this afternoon...to die for! Eat here! You get a TON of food for a great price, and everyone there is super friendly and helpful.

Hummus Xpress is a healthy, authentic restaurant that's great for lunch! I explain it as a chipotle for hummus(so clearly better). I always get the bowl, lamb or chicken, rice, red pepper hummus, and all the toppings I want. I leave feeling full and healthy and recommend this play to anyone. Not to mention, the staff is incredible and super accommodating/helpful!
Absolutely delicious and authentic food. A/c doesn't work well so it's a little warm this time of year. I will b back but may order it to go ;)
Everything was outstanding.  Lunch bowl with rice, chicken, broccoli, jalapeño cilantro hummus, tabbouleh, + toppings and pita for under $10. What's not to like?

Awesome concept for Mediterranean food (like Chipotle). The people were great and very friendly. The food was right up there with others I've had. Definitely give this place a try. 

4 stars because of atmosphere. It's a very basic to-go feel. I'd still go again!

First time in.red pepper hummus,gyro and chicken was succulent.this is now my go to place,to eat in or fly by and pickup.Nicole explained the dishes and informed us of her favorites with a smile through out,as well came out to ask if everything was good and up to our expectations. Thank you Nicole !!

Since I have discovered this place October of 2015, I have been here easily 50+ times.  I'm 2nd in Check In's here for a reason.  Everything here is made in house every day with the freshest ingredients and the majority of it is vegan safe, they also offer a range of specialty drinks and pastry cupcakes as well to add variety to their menu.  The food is ALWAYS consistent and amazing.  When every I bring someone here to try it, they don't just say: "this is good", they say: "WOW.. This is AMAZING!".  They do an amazing job at personalizing your experience every time you go in, a place where everyone knows your name and they treat you like family, always greeting you and always telling to "have a wonderful day", always telling you "thank you for coming in today" and letting you know that your business is appreciated.  Hummus Xpress is hands down with out a doubt not only the best place I have ever eaten, but my favorite place to eat.  I'm very thankful they are around and I hope after reading this review you will come in for the same experience I have had again and again.

Been to this place twice. I live in New Mexico. I was there a second time because I made sure to book the same hotel so I'd be close to this place.

SO good. Lemonade with rosewater! Braised kale. Delicious chick pea and lentil salads. GREAT falafal. Good tzaziki. YUMMY baklavah.

Had leftovers that I scarfed a few hours later at my hotel. I have a roving palate, but there was nothing I wanted more than more of my Hummus Xpress. 

Call first. I was sad to find out they were closed pretty early on the weekends.

I used to go hear with empty stomach, but now the prices have gone up and the food portions have gone down.... time to move on. 
They do have good food though.. cant just bash them.

I recommend hummus xpress to everyone who likes good Mediterranean food! The combo choices offer anything you can think of- a great selection of meats, hot and cold veg, hummus, and sauces. My boyfriend and I got to sample ALL of the hummus options and it was so hard to pick which was best because they were ALL unique and delicious! I got the "bowl" which is the smallest of the combo meals, but it was very filling and satisfying AND I have leftovers for lunch tomorrow.
Finally, the service was tremendous! The gentlemen serving the food were very knowledgable and were eager to give recommendations :)

I've been to hummus express maybe 3 or 4 times now, and I must say they are hard to beat when it comes to speed, flavor, and portion size. I've always gotten a hummus bowl, but recently got the pita instead and you get more than enough food that it's an even better value. For the hot veggies, I absolutely recommend either fried eggplant or their grilled zucchini (my new favorite), and the tabbouleh salad is quite good as well. Their gyro is a bit fattier than I'd prefer, but I still can't get enough of it. You can get as many toppings as you'd like too!

This place is an absolute gem and a must for either lunch or dinner

I've been waiting to go to this place!!!!!! Let's say third time is a charm! Hummus xpress was finally open! I ordered the plate with lamb gyro and beef brisket!!! Mmmmm! The goodness didn't stop there.

I went for the beet and chipotles hummus, all the sides (I love vegetables) and you must know their is unlimited toppings of your choosing. To top it off I got garlic aioli and taZiki. I'll be back before my flight out!

I also received free tea with the yelp deal and finished off dinner with a pistachio baklava.
This place is an awesome change from the norm. Great food, cool people, and lots of options. I will be coming back.

This is the best place in the Phoenix area to get an authentic Pita. It really reminds me of Pita/falafel stands I have been to in the middle East. 

Don't be afraid to try everything! It is all good. 
My recommendation is to not miss out on the fried eggplant and schug.

Close to the office and way better food than a drive-thru.  First time there today and I was warmly greeted and guided through my choices.  I got a bowl with rice, broccoli, chicken, classic hummus, tabouli and some tzatziki, with a wheat pita.  Plenty of food.  Price was fair.  I'm adding it to my Go To places for lunch.
Great for a quick bite and won't leave you feeling like your in a food coma the rest of the day!
My first time to this place and from out of town. Went there for lunch and it was amazing! Customer service was excellent! Also, I will be back there for dinner.

I don't understand the hype. I did not like this place one bit. It was very easy to find, and very convenient because I work down the street from this place, so this is how they got the one star. So I walked in, I was impressed because it was very quaint and clean. This usually puts me in a good mood when the area is clean. So I checked out the menu online before I came so I can get an idea of the options. I was super amped!! I adore hummus, pita and veggies,  so I felt like I was winning !! Wrong, the vegetarian bowl was this weird combination of cold, soggy and hot stuff piled on top of each other. I believe they are trying to emulate Chipotle ' s Aesthetic, sorry, not feeling it. What did it in for me is that the kale was cooked with the stems on. What a lazy move! I will not be coming here again.  Sorry

SUPER TASTY, Friendly Staff, FREE TEA with a YELP CHECK IN. I had the Tasty Falafel. The traditional hummus was very tasty. I had the tabouleh salad. Very tasty. The tzatziki sauce is made with yogurt. The tzatziki sauce is very good. Small dining room. Maybe 40 people max. Good access to Interstate 10. Easy to find.
Awesome food. Great value and service. Highly recommend the hummus and veggies because they were delicious and nutricious!

This place is great! The staff is efficient and friendly when choosing your options and there is plenty of parking. 

The food is fantastic! If you like Mediterranean style, then I don't see a need for anywhere else. Prices are reasonable and the portions are the perfect size. I elect to get the plate w/gyro meat rice and 2 sides w/salad , hummus and a pita.
Do it. You won't regret going if you like Mediterranean style.
Had a chicken salad with the eggplant. Tried the roasted pepper hummus with it. . Lots of toppings to choose from. It was really good

Reading the previous reviews I feel like I missed something. Wanted a gyro today and thought I would try someplace new. Went in and the gentlemen working the counter were very nice and explained how everything worked and made some suggestions. I was already planning on a gyro so I went with that. 

The pita was very good and ended up being the best part of the meal. The meat was swimming in oil/grease to the point where it was hard to choke down. The flavor was ok, but they were thick hunks that seemed like they were fried in oil to make them crispy. I generally prefer a more shaved gyro but my issue is more with all the grease pouring off the meat. The tzatziki sauce was very bitter and they used a ton of it. It was like having tzatziki meat soup served on a pita. I actually ended up scraping most of it off. It also didn't sit with me very well after the fact. I can't imagine I'll be back but based on all the good reviews, maybe it was just an off day.

This place is so good and filling! I ate this a few times. You can make your own bowl and put how much of it you want. The owners of the restaurant are friendly and are usually working. I've ordered food for lunch and had it for both lunch and dinner because there was that much of it left over, it was so good! Definitely try this place out, you won't regret it.

Totally delicious food and the service could not have been nicer.  I asked the clerk for a suggestion and he hooked me up personally. He prepared a bowl, mix of beef & chicken & veggies. The saffron rice has the best flavor... My meal was colorful, healthy & delicious. I'm a future return customer!

This place is amazing. I've eaten here twice now and both times were great. The menu is a little complicated, but the staff is really friendly and will walk you through the process. Tons of options for vegetarians. Everything has great flavor and the food somehow all works together in one big bowl. Standouts for me are the chipotle hummus and the eggplant.

Hot pink hummus? Now you're speaking my language. This place is like a delicious choose your own Mediterranean flavor adventure. 

You can get a pita, salad or bowl and fix it up the way you want- sort of like Chipotle or Cafe Rio. Everything I tried was outstanding. I had two kinds of hummus- beet and cilantro. The star for me was beet. It was slightly sweet and so pretty on the plate- neon pink!

The chicken was tender and flavorful and the bowl had saffron rice which was also a delight. The tzatziki sauce had a slight spicy kick which I've never had, but ended up really enjoying as well. 

The owner was working the counter and he was so nice. I really hope this place does well. 

I'll be back for sure!!

Pretty bomb!! Total dive in a marginal area.

It's basically a Subway but Mediterranean style food and you make it into the bowl you want. It's solid.

Skip their Gluten Free  cupcakes. Those were terrible.

When you're done grab a Donut at the Donut Co in the same parking lot. Apple Fritter donuts to die for.

Will be back

This place would get 5 stars, but the hours are so terrible, and you never know if you're going to get there and see it closed for some reason. When they are open, they can not be beat. I haven't found a more enjoyable mediterranean food experience... when they are actually open that is.

We came here for dinner tonight. Five stars for the service alone. Granted we were the only customers in the building, but the owner/chef really went above and beyond to please us on our first visit. Really, I was blown away.

The food was good. I could tell that some of the items had been sitting out for a while. But I do not fault them for it. Why? Because it was completely dead inside. According to the owner/chef, they are extremely busy during lunch hours, but traffic slows down severely around dinnertime. Given that, they at least had every advertised item available, and most of it looked and tasted fresh.

So come on, people. Try this place for dinner sometime. Not only will the owner thank you, but so will the rest of the dinnertime customers.

I had a FANTASTIC lunch date here with my husband today. They had live music (not sure why) but it didn't last long. 

The food was SOOOOO tasty. It was nice to have so many side vegetable options. I got to try a huge variety of food (3 sides, 2 kids of hummus, 1 protein, and all the toppings you can want).

It was a lite and refreshing lunch. The service was EXCELLENT (i.e. the guys behind the counter were really nice). I'll be going back a lot.
This place has many vegan options and it's all labeled as you pick out what you want to eat. My falafel bowl was great! Loved the garlic hummus I had with it.

This place turned out to be a VERY nice surprise. It is definitely similar to Chipotle but the quality of food here is much better in my opinion. Im only comparing it to Chipotle due to the similarites as making your order and choosing what you would like. Fresh cooked veggies, variety in meat and hummus. You also get rice and toppings as well. 

Easy quick dinner to pick up and take home and its very filling...and given that you pretty much cannot get anything that's unhealthy here you dont feel as guilty after you stuff your face and devour the whole bowl :)

For Mediterranean-style food this place is awesome!
They have a huge variety of food and it all tastes really good.
The flavors are perfect and when you get a plate, it will be more than enough food for anyone.
This place is amazing. They have a lemon ginger hummus that is out of this world! And their eggplant is excellent as well. Great value, and fresh ingredients with friendly staff.

A-may-zing. 

Think Chipotle-style, pick your stuff, but for Middle Eastern food. If they have this same stuff each day, I could eat here daily.

If you have not been here, you are missing out. I highly suggest you stop by.

I got a bowl and all vegan ingredients: chipotle hummus, beet hummus, tabboule, kale, falafel, etc.

Can't wait till we have like 6 or 7 of these in town.

This is probably one of the weirder reviews I'll ever write. When I rate something 5 stars, not only does the food have to be hallucination-inducing, uncontrollably drooling awesome, but so does the service itself. In this case, the service pretty much is non-existent and confusing to the core but they have me whipped, chained, and weak at the knees for their food. 

Eddie owns the place and he's pretty awesome at what he does. The flavors are so intense and so on point but not only that, they're kind of visually stunning as well. Be mesmerized by how intensely pink the beet hummus is or be nervous when you see how many fresh green jalapeno specks there are in the cilantro hummus. Their rice is a beautiful saffron golden color and always fluffy like a pillow. Their meats, especially their lamb and beef ... would you like some meat with your steamy meat juices? Because that's how succulent they are. Everything is just an explosion of flavor because of how many herbs and spices they use in each dish. I will warn you that by eating their potatoes, you should plan on not speaking to anyone for the next 8 hours because it is just deliciously bombarded with an obnoxious amount of garlic. 

I order catering all the time for my workplace and the moment the work floor get an email that there's Hummus Xpress - they drop everything for it. These full grown men are willing to sit still through a 45-minute vendor presentation that probably doesn't even relate to what they do just to be able to enjoy the food rather than go out for lunch themselves. In our world, that's some major dedication. 

Service? Let's just say it's been a trip. Sometimes when I call to order, their phone line doesn't work and they just don't fix it - just because. So then you're stuck for 3 months having to resort to ordering something else while you live on edge that your insatiable coworkers might jump you. Finally get a hold of them? Kitchen fire - closed. Need a catering order? E-mail it and hope that they show up at the time you requested because they never responded or asked for payment. Get the receipt - not even sure what they charged you for but it looks about right because you're too busy already stuffing your face. I'm sure it's different when you're there in person, but no matter how many obstacles they throw my way to make it seem like they don't want my business at all, I still keep vying for their attention like some crazy pre-teen Justin Bieber fan.

This place is amazing. Friendly staff, fast food and a nice, small and cozy place to eat.
Food is great. Love the different authentic toppings and the vast variety of hummus.

Good baklava as well.
I had the hummus bowl with chicken and LOVED IT!! Would definitely recommend this place, new favorite! The beet hummus is a must!

Tried it couple of weeks ago, the flavors are alright, but the food was really cold and the rice was dry and crunchy, its like been sitting in the heat overnight. Being Lebanese and being familiar with the authentic food, I was fooled by 4.5 stars!

Came here today for the first time in a long while. They're food has definitely not changed and they still have amazing quality. I got the pita ($7) with rice, chicken, zucchini, jalapeño cilantro hummus, olives, cucumbers, tomatoes, cheese, and peppers, with garlic aioli sauce. Perfect price for a lot of food! The only downside is that I don't live close enough to come on a regular basis, but I did see that they have a food truck! Employees are also very friendly and were remembering other people's previous orders.
This is one of my favorite lunch spots in the hood. It's quick and you get a ton of food. The cilantro jalapeño sauce is good on errythang.

This place is pretty good.  The portions are pretty good sized, I got a Gyro and my wife got a falafel pita.  Both were really tasty.  We got the red pepper hummus which was about the only minor disappointment.  It didn't taste bad, but it was thin in consistency so that included with everything else made the pita soggy.  I am anxious to try other things there though, lots of variety.
The best in Tempe for a fast, filling and healthy meal! Their falafel is the best I've ever had.
This place is great. Awesome hummus and great veggie options. Meat has always been good and you can get lunch for under $8.

What can I say about this place? It's awesome, delicious, such a great spot.

The only sort of complaint is that their brewed ice tea is often moldy. You can absolutely tell that it's either being kept around too long, not being brewed fresh and regularly.....or something needs to get cleaned out. If this issue was addressed this place would be perfect to me :-)

We got bowls mixed with classic and jalapeno hummus, with pickled veggies, eggplant and pepperoncinis with some whole wheat pita.
I kid you not, my dining companion licked the bowl.  I wanted to, but I managed to scrape the bowl clean and then i admit, I used my fingers too...unbelievably delicious.  Now, if he just delivered, I'd spend all my money here!

Kind of an interesting place - I think it reminds me of a old coffee house from the 70's but with food.

Speaking of food - it was amazing - lives up to its reputation- I enjoyed it and when I return to the are I will visit again.

Service was very orderly and efficient- I was concerned the lay (of service items) might make it difficult but no worries.

If you like her hummus - stop in!

I must say, it has been YEARS since i have been so excited about a restaurant as I was when I walked in to Hummas Xpress.  Food was awesome, portion was awesome, the staff was so friendly.  At one point I felt like I was being cheered on by all as I ordered each element of my platter... It was awesome.

Nice date night place too.  We took our food to go, but it was setup so nicely that next time we will have it to stay and enjoy ourselves a bit longer.

still really liking this place! and I recently learned that their vegetarian "bowl" option is great. usually with a bowl you get 1 meat, 1 veggie, 1 hummus, 1 salad.  with the vegetarian option you get 2 veggies, 2 salads, and 2 hummus!  I ordered that last night and it was delicious.  the broccoli is my favorite.  it's one of those places where you can eat vegetarian and not feel deprived afterwards or hungry again 1 hour later....

Food was really good but be careful with the kalamata olives still have seeds and I was not expecting that as I bit into my pita. :( 
Food was good great but, I about chipped a tooth with the first bite.
The flavor and spices are great however it was on food that was sitting for a while.  Healthier options available.  The plate is good if your hungry, has a lot of options.

This place was TASTY!! It was a bit confusing at first figuring out how to order, but the owner was great and explained it all. I ended up with a hummus bowl + falafel for only like $5. The falafel were fresh and I liked both hummus's (hummusi? hummuses? hummus's?). I tried the red pepper and jalepeno ones. 

They also have shug. For those of you that don't know, shug is incredible. It's so spicy and amazing and no falafel/hummus feast is complete without it, yet it's annoyingly hard to find here. Hummus Xpress has deliciously fiery lovely shug that made my day. 

Overall, great place to check out and hopefully they open more locations!

A friend of ours recommend this place, otherwise we probably would never even have known it existed. Now, it's easily turned into one of our favorite restaurants.

We went in not having any idea how the ordering process was going to work. The menu is a little confusing, because it's different, but the guy at the counter could tell we were newbs so jumped right in to help us out. Basically, you can choose from a couple different plates that are $5 or less, or start with a larger plate or bowl and add stuff to it from there. You end with sauces, and if you are vegan they label which you can eat.

I got the Hummus with Falafel. You get to choose up to two kinds of hummus and add all the topping you want (there are loads of interesting toppings to choose from). The falafel was AMAZING. Not dry and pasty at all. Hot and crispy on the outside and oh so light and fluffy on the inside. Some of the best I've had. The hummus was smooth and flavorful. I ended up with an amazing amount of food for less than $5! 

My boyfriend got the gyro meat with herbed sweet potatoes with all kinds of other awesomeness. When it came time to eat, he said he couldn't get it into his face fast enough. So good!

He had a fountain drink and I made an Arnold Palmer with their unsweetened flavored iced tea per the guy at the counter's recommendation  (I think it was a peach lavender tea or something like that - it was very good and they also had a black tea and mint one too).

We'll be returning for sure. The people were incredibly nice and the food was affordable, of great quality and had great flavor. Quite the little gem in a city that feels like it is busting at the seams with Mediterranean cuisine.

this place is like a greek chipotle. you can be an healthy or unhealthy as you would like, but everything is great! its quick and easy and great for a quick fresh lunch. i would definitly recommend this place!!

A little expensive for the food and it seemed like the food has been sitting out there for quite a while. The vegetables were soggy and very salty especially the eggplant. The hummus selection was good though.

One of my favorite places to go. The staff is very friendly and always making great recommendations for the perfect dish. The food itself is truly delicious, and there are so many options to try for a low cost.

Good, decent, fast Mediterranean food. You can mix and match your plate or bowl with many different types of meats, hummus, and salad. 
Good for on the go if you're craving Mediterranean food. Mind you that if they have a slow day, it may be sitting for a few in the warmers so you won't get that freshly cooked meat that you would get a sit down restaurant. 

Staff is very nice.

The food is very good to the point of being unique.  

You can get most of what is served here elsewhere, if you stop at several different restaurants, but I think you'd be hard pressed to find a single place that does what Hummus Xpress does.

This is the third or fourth time I've been here but  it occurred to me today that if you're one of those people who doesn't like their food touching this might not be the place for you since everything kind of goes into one big pile.  Frankly it makes for some very interesting flavors, but it may not be for everyone.
Very friendly and helpful staff. Experience is like Chipotle. You select what items you want in your bowl. Very tasty. Gluten free selection is good. I'll be back.
This place was really good. Lots of great choices, great service and really fast. I ordered the hummus bowl with falafels. Everything was good. i like the orginal hummus the best. I will go back
Nice spices: especially love the carrots, kale, and broccoli. Good portions. Friendly service. Would definitely go back.

I am soooooooooooooooooooooooooo excited about this place!! Quick and delicious! Just as another reviewer described, it's like the Mediterranean  version of Chipotle. You do order from right to left, you get to pick your rice, meat and veggie, hummus and as many toppings as you would like (like olives, and, other things... yeah, I was only interested in the olives) 

I was actually expecting the food not to be too fresh since it's basically served buffet style, but it was surprisingly fresh and perfect! I had the gyro meat and I honestly think it's the best gyro meat I've had in Tempe so far. Super moist and flavorful and it didn't give me indigestion! The hummus was really good, I had the plain one (If someone can't make plain hummus right, then there is no point in trying the flavored ones) It was good!!! I asked if it was made in house or bought, they told me everything is made in house.

Even the drinks were exciting! I had lavender-peach tea. It was fresh and I loved that it wasn't sweetened. Don't forget to check in and get a free tea! 

This will definitely be a regular lunch spot for me....how can you beat cheap, fresh and delicious?
